advert.headline: Chris Bumstead’s LS376-Powered 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Coupe 5-Speed
Supercharged 427-Powered 1968 Ford Mustang GT500CR 900S 6-Speed by Classic Recreations

advert.model: 488 Spider Force of Nature Series: Earth
advert.headline: 105-Mile 2019 Ferrari 488 Spider Force of Nature Series: Earth
4,200-Mile 2006 Mercedes-Benz SLR McLaren
advert.description:
This 2006 Mercedes-Benz SLR McLaren has 4,200 miles and is finished in Crystal Laurite Silver over 300SL Red Silver Arrow leather. It is powered by a supercharged 5.4-liter M155 V8 linked to an AMG Speedshift R five-speed automatic transmission, and further equipment includes 19″ turbine-spoke wheels, carbon-ceramic disc brakes, butterfly doors, xenon headlights, side-exit exhaust pipes, carbon-fiber seats, a CD changer, and a Bose sound system. The car was acquired by the seller in May 2025 following registration history in Florida, Arizona, Montana, and Georgia, and the batteries were replaced in September 2025. This SLR McLaren is now offered in California with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.
The SLR was built with a carbon-fiber monocoque and crash structures. This example is finished in Crystal Laurite Silver and features upward-opening butterfly doors, xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, heated side mirrors, twin side-exit exhaust outlets behind each front wheel, and an electronically deployed rear spoiler air brake. The seller tells us that paint protection film has been applied to the body.

advert.headline: RoW 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe Vesuvio Edition X51 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe is one of a reported 60 Vesuvio Edition examples produced, all of which featured Vesuvio Metallic paintwork with Steel Grey accents, and it was also ordered with the X51 power kit, 18″ Technology hollow-spoke wheels, aluminum-look gauges, and heated power-height-adjustable front seats. Power is provided by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car also has a speed-activated rear spoiler, a Blaupunkt CD stereo, aluminum interior accessories, cruise control, power windows, and air conditioning. The car was initially delivered to Sweden and remained there through the 2021 purchase by Swedish collector and former Gant design director Staffan Wittmark. It was then acquired by the selling dealer and relocated to the US, where preparation for the sale consisted of changing the fluids and replacing the battery, spark plugs, ignition wires, accessory belts, and brake rotors. Showing 60k kilometers (~37k miles), this 993 C2S is offered at no reserve with a Porsche Classic Technical Certificate, owner’s manuals, a tool kit, an air compressor, service records, prior sales documents, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.
The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera. This non-sunroof example was factory-finished in Vesuvio Metallic (L40X), and work in 2024 included replacing the front bumper cover and correcting the finish on the left-rear quarter panel in addition to repainting the hood, front fenders, rocker panels, and bumper covers. Exterior details include headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 2021 Rolls-Royce Ghost
advert.description:
This 2021 Rolls-Royce Ghost is finished in Tempest Grey over Grace White leather upholstery with orange accents and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 6.75-liter V12 linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission. It has been fitted with 24″ forged Rayanni wheels, and factory equipment includes adjustable air suspension, rear-wheel steering, and power-closing rear-hinged doors along with a Shooting Star Headliner, a head-up display, adaptive cruise control, and heated, ventilated, and massaging front seats. The car also has a surround-view camera system, touchscreen infotainment, heated and massaging rear seats, rear entertainment screens and picnic tables, and umbrellas stowed in the rear doors. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this second-generation Ghost has 18k miles and is offered in California with an owner’s manual, a spare set of 21″ wheels, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
The car is finished in Tempest Grey with orange pinstripes and has a retractable Spirit of Ecstasy hood ornament, Park Assist, adaptive LED headlights, power-closing rear-hinged doors, and dual exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 25k-Mile 2010 Rolls-Royce Phantom Drophead Coupe
advert.description:
This 2010 Rolls-Royce Phantom Drophead Coupe was first registered in New York and then relocated to Canada in 2011 before the selling dealer brought the car back to the US in 2025, sold it on BaT in September of that year , and recently reacquired it. The vehicle was specified with Midnight Sapphire paint, a Navy Blue soft top, a brushed stainless-steel bonnet, a teak rear deck, Santos Pallisander veneer interior trim, and Seashell and Navy Blue leather upholstery. Power is provided by a 6.75-liter V12 mated to a six-speed automatic transmission. Additional equipment includes a retractable Spirit of Ecstasy ornament, power-assisted rear-hinged doors, a camera system, bi-xenon headlights, 21″ polished wheels, automatic load-leveling suspension, heated front seats, sisal floor mats, a Lexicon Logic7 audio system, and a rotating dashboard-mounted infotainment screen with navigation. This Phantom Drophead Coupe now has 25k miles and is offered in California with a clean Carfax report and a clean Ohio title.
The Phantom Drophead Coupe features alloy and composite body panels over an aluminum space-frame chassis with double-floor construction. Over 44,000 colors were offered from the factory, with this example being finished in Midnight Sapphire and equipped with a Navy Blue convertible soft top, a brushed stainless-steel bonnet, a teak rear deck, a retractable Spirit of Ecstasy hood ornament, a camera system, front and rear parking sensors, bi-xenon headlights, and LED taillights. Clear paint-protection film is said to cover the exterior finish. The left-side mirror was re-secured in July 2025, and previously applied window-tint film was removed in preparation for the sale. The odometer and whole-car exterior photos were taken in January 2026, with the remainder of the gallery shot in July 2025.

advert.headline: 10k-Mile 2018 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS Coupe
advert.description:
This 2018 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS is a silver-over-black coupe that has 10k miles and was optioned from the factory with the Premium Package Plus. Powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle, the car is further equipped with Soul Performance catalytic converters, Rennline front bumper cover screens, the Sport Chrono Package, a limited-slip differential, Porsche Torque Vectoring, center-locking 20″ Turbo S alloy wheels, LED headlights with PDLS+, ParkAssist parking sensors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control, PASM sport suspension, rear-axle steering, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, and a Bose sound system. This 991.2 GTS coupe was purchased by the seller in 2024 and is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The GTS features wider bodywork than the standard Carrera as well as a front lower lip spoiler, side skirts, SportDesign side mirrors, and a revised front apron. This example is finished in GT Silver Metallic and was specified without a sunroof. It has LED headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus as well as a speed-activated rear spoiler, ParkAssist parking sensors, Rennline front bumper cover screens, LED taillights, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the front end, and paint meter readings along with close-up photos of imperfections are provided in the gallery.

advert.headline: 20k-Mile 1995 Ferrari 456 GT 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1995 Ferrari 456 GT was registered with two owners in New York, Texas, and Florida before it was listed on BaT in March 2023 , and it now shows 20k miles following the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024. A major service was completed in January 2026 with replacement of the timing belt, radiator, water pump, thermostat, intake manifold gaskets, camshaft seals, and additional components as detailed below. Additional work under current ownership included interior leather repairs, installing a set of Continental tires, and replacing the brake and suspension accumulators. Finished in Verde Inglese over tan Connolly leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 5.5-liter F116 V12 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, aftermarket exhaust components, 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels, pop-up headlights, fog lights, power-adjustable front seats, a gated shifter, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This 456 GT is now offered in California by the selling dealer with manufacturer’s literature, a tool kit, recent service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
The Pininfarina-designed aluminum and composite bodywork is finished in Verde Inglese (606) and features pop-up headlights, integrated fog lights, and polished quadruple exhaust tips exiting through the rear valance. The rear bumper was repainted under previous ownership, and the selling dealer tells us that paintwork was performed on several areas before their acquisition. Scrapes are noted on the lower portion of the rear bumper cover.

advert.headline: 2023 Chevrolet Corvette Z06 Coupe 3LZ
advert.description:
This 2023 Chevrolet Corvette Z06 is a black-over-black coupe that was optioned with the 3LZ Equipment Group, and it was purchased new by the owner at Webb Chevrolet of Plainfield in Illinois. Powered by a 5.5-liter LT6 V8 paired with an eight-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle, the car has 7k miles and is further equipped with an electronic limited-slip differential, a front-axle lift system, carbon-fiber interior trim, a removable roof panel, LED headlights, 20″ and 21″ forged aluminum wheels, Magnetic Selective Ride Control, heated and ventilated GT2 bucket seats, a Bose sound system, front and rear cameras, and a touchscreen infotainment system. This C8 Z06 is now offered in Colorado on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and an Illinois title.
The car is finished in black and has a removable roof panel, a rear spoiler, window tint, LED headlights, side air intakes, and rear parking sensors. A ceramic coating has been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

advert.headline: 2012 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS
advert.description:
This 2012 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS coupe has accrued 68k miles following registration in California since new. Finished in Black, the car was optioned with a black full leather interior, heated leather-back adaptive sport seats, the Sport Chrono Package Plus, PCM 3.0 with Extended Navigation, Bose surround sound, a fire extinguisher, bi-xenon headlights with PDLS, and clear taillights. Power comes from a 3.8-liter flat-six linked with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle and a limited-slip differential, and it is further equipped with 19” RS Spyder center-lock wheels, a sport suspension, a power sunroof, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the seller in 2025, this 997.2 Carrera GTS coupe is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The 997 GTS featured a revised front apron with larger air intakes, wider bodywork shared with the contemporary Carrera 4S, and a black front lip spoiler, side skirts, and rear diffuser. This example is finished in Black, and exterior details include bi-xenon headlights with Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS), a power sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, clear taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint-protection film has been applied to the front bumper cover, hood, mirrors, and quarter panels.

advert.headline: 1,400-Mile 2007 Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 Coupe
advert.description:
This 2007 Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 coupe remained with its original owner for 14 years before it spent the next five years with its second owner, and it has 1,400 miles. The car was ordered with a Shaker 1000 sound system and the GT500 Premier Trim Package for the black leather-trimmed cabin, which also has a power-adjustable driver’s seat. Finished in Performance White with blue stripes, additional details include a supercharged 5.4-liter V8, a six-speed manual transmission, a limited-slip differential, quarter window louvers, 18″ forged alloy wheels, and Brembo front brake calipers. This Shelby GT500 is now offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, a Shelby American Certificate of Authenticity, accessories, magazines, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.
The car is finished in Performance White (HP) with blue over-the-top and side stripes, and exterior details include fog lights, hood vents, a rear spoiler, quarter window louvers, Shelby badging, and polished exhaust outlets. Photographs of paint-meter readings are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 19k-Mile 2016 Volkswagen Touareg Executive TDI
advert.description:
This 2016 Volkswagen Touareg Executive TDI has 19k miles and is finished in Pure White over Terracotta Brown Vienna leather. Equipment includes a panoramic sunroof, a Surround-View camera system, a Dynaudio sound system, adaptive cruise control, 21″ Mallory wheels, heated and ventilated front seats, a receiver hitch, and a heated steering wheel and rear seats. Power is provided by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission and a 4MOTION permanent four-wheel-drive system. Recently acquired by the seller, this 7P Touareg is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a Colorado title.
The SUV is finished in Pure White (LC9A) with chrome trim and features a panoramic sunroof, a receiver hitch, adaptive xenon headlights, fog lights, roof rails, a rear window wiper, and Park Distance Control parking sensors. Photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 31k-Mile 2016 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray Coupe 3LT Z51
advert.description:
This 2016 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray coupe was ordered with the Spice Red Design Package, which specified a Spice Red interior, Shark Gray exterior vents, and polished 19″ and 20″ Motorsports aluminum wheels. The seller purchased the car in September 2016, and they have since added approximately 30k of the 31k indicated miles while registering it in New Mexico. Finished in Arctic White, the coupe is powered by a 6.2-liter LT1 V8 linked with an eight-speed automatic gearbox and a limited-slip differential. The 3LT Preferred Equipment Group added heated and ventilated seats, a Performance Data and Video recorder, a head-up display, and a front curb-view camera. Other equipment includes the Z51 Performance Package, Magnetic Ride Control suspension, a removable roof panel, a multi-mode exhaust, and an aftermarket wind deflector. This C7 Stingray is now offered with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller’s name.
The body is finished in Arctic White with red and gray graphics and is further outfitted with a body-color removable roof panel, Shark Gray vents, xenon headlights, and a vented carbon-fiber hood with a black Stingray graphic. White headlight overlays are installed, and chips are visible above the windshield on the passenger side.

advert.headline: 1996 Ford F-350 XLT Power Stroke 4×4 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1996 Ford F-350 XLT 4×4 is a regular-cab long-bed pickup that remained registered to the original owners in Oregon through November 2025 and now has 171k miles. Finished in Dark Hunter Green Metallic and Colonial White over Mocha cloth, the truck is powered by a turbodiesel 7.3-liter Power Stroke V8 linked to a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes 16″ eight-hole alloy wheels, air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, a cassette stereo, and dual fuel tanks. This F-350 is offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title.
The truck is finished in Dark Hunter Green Metallic (ND) and Colonial White (Y0) and features chrome bumpers, swing-away side mirrors, side steps, bedside tie-down cleats, and a spray-in bedliner. The hood and roof have been repainted, and crows’ feet and etching are pictured in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 2013 Mercedes-Benz ML63 AMG
advert.description:
This 2013 Mercedes-Benz ML63 AMG has 58k miles following history in California, and the truck remained registered with the original owner until 2024. It is finished in Palladium Silver Metallic over black leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V8 linked with a seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes a sunroof, bi-xenon headlights, Parktronic parking sensors, 21″ AMG twin five-spoke wheels, Keyless Go, heated and ventilated front seats, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, COMAND with navigation, and three-zone automatic climate control. This W166 ML63 AMG is now offered by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.
The truck is finished in Palladium Silver Metallic (792) and features a sunroof, retractable headlight washers, Parktronic parking sensors, bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination, and quad exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 19k-Mile 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera Cabriolet 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet has 19k miles and was optioned with a Metropol Blue soft top, 19″ Carrera S wheels, Porsche Active Suspension Management, the Bi-Xenon Headlamp Package, a sport exhaust system, heated power-adjustable seats, a sport shifter, and the Bose High End Sound Package. Finished in Carrara White over Sea Blue full leather, the car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six linked to six-speed manual transaxle. A Pioneer touchscreen stereo with Apple CarPlay has been installed, and additional equipment includes fog lights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, automatic climate control, and cruise control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2020, this 997.1 cabriolet is now offered in Georgia with the removed PCM unit and CD changer, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.
The car is finished in Carrara White with a Metropol Blue soft top. Additional equipment includes bi-xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and polished exhaust outlets. The hood shocks and washer pump were replaced in 2026.

advert.headline: 1972 BMW 2002tii
advert.description:
This 1972 BMW 2002tii has been refinished in Riviera Blue and fitted with an Ansa exhaust system and 13″ Cosmic wheels. The car is powered by a 2.0-liter M10 inline-four paired with a four-speed manual transmission and is equipped with Kugelfischer mechanical fuel injection, a cassette stereo, a heater, and reclining front seats. It was acquired by the current owner in 2020, and subsequent work involved replacing the clutch, rear main seal, and transmission seals along with the tires. This roundie tii is now offered on dealer consignment with a tool kit, service records, a BMW Birth Certificate, and a clean Nevada title.
Finished from the factory in Polaris Metallic, the car was refinished in Riviera Blue during a refurbishment prior to 2000. The seller notes that the front clip sheet metal has been replaced, and exterior equipment includes dual side mirrors, vent windows, bright trim, and round taillights. There is a blemish on the left rear window along with various chips in the paint.

advert.headline: 2002 Chevrolet Suburban 2500 LT 8.1L 4×4
advert.description:
This 2002 Chevrolet Suburban 2500 LT 4×4 has 102k miles after time in Colorado and California. It is finished in Light Pewter Metallic over tan leather and powered by an 8.1-liter Vortec V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a locking rear differential. Equipment includes a power sunroof, an Autoride suspension, 16″ forged aluminum wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a CD/cassette stereo. This GMT800 Suburban is offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.
The exterior is finished in Light Pewter Metallic with matching wheel arch flares and features a power sunroof, fog lights, roof rails, running boards, a receiver hitch, and heated power-adjustable side mirrors with ground illumination.

advert.headline: 31k-Mile 2007 Mercedes-Benz SL55 AMG P30 Performance Package
advert.description:
This 2007 Mercedes-Benz SL55 AMG was purchased in 2013 by the current owner, who has kept it in their collection and has added approximately 1,600 of the 31k miles. Powered by a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission, the car was optioned with the P30 AMG Performance Package, which added a limited-slip differential, a second oil cooler, larger brakes, a revised front fascia, and an increased speed limiter. Finished in Black over beige leather, additional appointments include a power-retractable hardtop, Parktronic parking sensors, bi-xenon headlights, 19″ two-piece alloy wheels, heated and ventilated multi-contour seats, a Bose sound system, and Keyless Go. This R230 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the owner’s name.
The car is finished in Black (040) and features a power-folding convertible hardtop. An “F1 safety car”-style front bumper cover with side air extractors was fitted as part of the P30 AMG Performance Package, and other equipment includes a rear spoiler, Parktronic parking sensors, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, fender air vents, and AMG bodywork including a revised front spoiler, side skirts, and quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the paintwork and trim are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 2016 Porsche Cayenne Turbo
advert.description:
This 2016 Porsche Cayenne Turbo is finished in Meteor Gray Metallic over Black leather and is equipped with the Sport Chrono Package, a panoramic sunroof, a receiver hitch, 21″ 911 Turbo Design wheels, Porsche Entry & Drive, and LED headlights with PDLS+. Power is provided by a 520-horsepower twin-turbocharged 4.8L V8 linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission. The vehicle spent time in California and Kentucky before the selling dealer first acquired it in March 2025, and they sold it to a family member who added 5k of the 71k indicated miles. Recently reacquired by the selling dealer, this Cayenne Turbo is now offered with a service record, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
The SUV is finished in Meteor Gray Metallic with High-Gloss Black trim and features LED headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus (PDLS+) as well as a panoramic sunroof, a receiver hitch, Black roof rails, and tinted LED taillights. The grille shutter actuator and right-rear door actuator were replaced in May 2025, and the front bumper cover has an indentation.

advert.headline: 2014 Mercedes-Benz GL550 4MATIC
advert.description:
This 2014 Mercedes-Benz GL550 has been registered in Florida since new, and it now has 43k miles. Finished in Iridium Silver Metallic over Porcelain Designo Nappa leather, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.6-liter V8 linked with a seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes 21″ AMG wheels, a panoramic sunroof, adaptive bi-xenon headlights, a powered tailgate, Distronic Plus cruise control, Parktronic parking sensors, a Surround View camera system, heated and ventilated multi-contour front seats, Keyless Go, Active Blind-Spot Assist, Active Lane Keeping Assit, a Harman Kardon surround sound system, COMAND with navigation, and three-zone automatic climate control. This X166 GL550 is offered at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.
The vehicle is finished in Iridium Silver Metallic (775), and exterior equipment includes a panoramic sunroof, bi-xenon headlights with an Active Curve Illumination System, power-folding side mirrors, parking sensors, a Surround View camera system, illuminated running boards, roof rails, a receiver hitch, a powered tailgate, and dual exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 32-Years-Owned 1987 Porsche 944 Turbo
advert.description:
This 1987 Porsche 944 Turbo was purchased by the current owner in 1994 and shows 96k miles. Powered by a turbocharged 2.5-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in Lemon Yellow over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ five-spoke wheels, pop-up headlights, fog lights, power-adjustable front seats, a sunroof, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 944 Turbo is offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean Michigan title.
The car is finished in Lemon Yellow (LM1A) and features a tilting sunroof with a removable panel as well as pop-up headlights, fog lights, a rear window wiper, and a rear spoiler. The fog light lenses are damaged, the paint protection film is blemished, and there is a scratch in the windshield and paint chips around the body.

advert.model: was designed by Tatra in secrecy due to government restrictions and was introduced in 1956. Production continued through 1975, and the cars were used almost exclusively by high-ranking party officials. This example features the last of three styling updates introduced throughout the model run, which included a redesigned front fascia. It was refinished in white under previous ownership and features chrome bumpers with overriders, yellow-lens driving lamps, door-mounted mirrors, quarter panel grilles, a split rear window, and rear mudflaps.
advert.headline: 1973 Tatra 2-603 II
advert.description:
This 1973 Tatra 2-603 II was built in Kopřivnice, Czechoslovakia, and comes from the third and final series of the model. The car is finished in white over two-tone black and red upholstery, and power comes from a rear-mounted, air-cooled 2.5L V8 paired with a column-shifted four-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, 15″ cream-painted wheels, yellow-lens driving lamps, door-mounted mirrors, front lap belts, and a heater. This 2-603 II was purchased by the seller in 2023, and it is now offered at no reserve in Slovakia with a superseded Czechoslovak registration booklet and Slovak registration in the seller’s name.
The T603 model was designed by Tatra in secrecy due to government restrictions and was introduced in 1956. Production continued through 1975, and the cars were used almost exclusively by high-ranking party officials. This example features the last of three styling updates introduced throughout the model run, which included a redesigned front fascia. It was refinished in white under previous ownership and features chrome bumpers with overriders, yellow-lens driving lamps, door-mounted mirrors, quarter panel grilles, a split rear window, and rear mudflaps.

advert.headline: Modified 1997 Mazda RX-7 Type RB Bathurst X 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1997 Mazda RX-7 is one of approximately 700 Type RB Bathurst X examples built for the model year and was brought to the US from Japan in 2025 following the selling dealer’s acquisition. The Brilliant Black body has been fitted with a widebody kit, a vented hood, a rear wing, and revised bumper covers, while the cabin has been outfitted with a MOMO steering wheel, a Recaro driver’s seat, and Blitz auxiliary gauges. Power comes from a twin-turbocharged 1.3-liter Wankel rotary paired with a five-speed manual transmission, and the car rides on 18″ Volk Racing alloy wheels in addition to a coilover suspension system. Further equipment includes hood pins, an aftermarket exhaust system, a Knight Sports speedometer, air conditioning, and a Carrozzeria head unit. This modified FD RX-7 is now offered by the selling dealer with a clean Massachusetts title.
The car left the factory finished in Brilliant Black (PZ) and has been fitted with a widebody kit as well as an aftermarket hood, rear wing, mirror assemblies, side skirts, and front and rear bumper covers under previous ownership. Additional details include pop-up headlights, hood pins, and a rear window wiper. Scratches and dings are noted on various body panels.

advert.headline: 15k-Mile 2001 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible
advert.description:
This 2001 Chevrolet Corvette convertible was purchased in the spring of 2019 by the seller’s father before it later transferred ownership to the seller’s mother in 2021, and it was then purchased in 2024 by the seller, who has added approximately 1,400 of the 15k miles. Finished in Torch Red over black leather, the car is powered by a 5.7-liter LS1 V8 paired with a four-speed automatic gearbox, and additional details include a limited-slip differential, a replacement black convertible soft top, pop-up headlights, 17″ and 18″ polished five-spoke wheels, power-adjustable seats, a Bose sound system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This C5 convertible is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a car cover, accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Torch Red, and exterior details include a replacement black convertible soft top, pop-up headlights, a Corvette-branded front plate cover, heated side mirrors, and quad exhaust outlets. A paint-correction service was carried out in 2019, at which time a ceramic coating was applied. Spare hydraulic pistons for the trunk are included in the sale.

advert.headline: 1967 Jaguar 420G
advert.description:
This 1967 Jaguar 420G was purchased new by a resident of Wisconsin, who received the car in the United Kingdom. The vehicle was relocated to California in the early 1980s by its second owner, and its third owner acquired the car out of Kansas in 1990 and kept it in California until 2023. The Jaguar has been repainted in two-tone green and white, and its green leather upholstery has been retrimmed. Powered by a 4.2-liter DOHC inline-six linked with a three-speed automatic transmission, the vehicle is equipped with triple SU carburetors, power steering, disc brakes, 14″ steel wheels, hubcaps, dual exhaust outlets, wood interior trim, air conditioning, a Motorola AM/FM radio, power windows, and rear-seat tray tables. The current owner purchased the car in 2024. This 420G is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a Jaguar Daimler Heritage Trust certificate, service records, and a clean Georgia title in the owner’s name.
Like the related 420 saloon, the 420G debuted for 1967 and was an evolution of Jaguar’s Mk X; the 420G rode on a 120.0″ wheelbase and measured 202.0″ in length—increases of 12.6″ and 14.2″, respectively, compared with the 420. Finished from the factory in Sand, this car is said to have been repainted in its current green and white in 1985. Exterior details include quad headlights, a fluted grille, a “leaper” hood ornament, a cowl vent, fender-mounted side mirrors, vent windows, bright trim, dual exhaust outlets, and wraparound chrome bumpers with overriders. The seller notes three rust bubbles near the driver door, aged paint, and body crumpling beneath the rear bumper.

advert.headline: 1976 Lancia Fulvia Coupe 1.3S
advert.description:
This 1976 Lancia Fulvia 3 1.3S imported to the United States from Italy in 2014, and it was subsequently refurbished before being listed on BaT in March 2019 . Powered by a 1,298cc V4 linked with a five-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in brown over black OMP seats. Work conducted since the previous BaT listing has involved overhauling the suspension and the brakes, installing gold-colored Cromodora-style 14″ wheels, replacing the seats and the fuel tank, rebuilding the carburetors, applying racing-style graphics, removing the bumpers, and adding a digital speedometer. Other features include fog lights, a wood dashboard, a Squadra Corse steering wheel, and an aftermarket shift knob. The seller purchased the vehicle in mid-2025. This modified Fulvia is now offered with an owner’s manual, a shop manual, Italian paperwork, records dating back to 2004, Lancia books, spare and removed factory parts, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.
The Fulvia coupe was designed in-house by Piero Castagnero and saw early racing success with a class win at the Targa Florio in 1966. This example was subjected to a glass-out repaint in Marrone Parioli in 2017. The bumpers were removed, fog lights were installed, and racing-style graphics and roundels were applied since the aforementioned 2018 BaT auction. Other exterior equipment includes quad headlights, a driver-side mirror, and a white tail panel. A seller-provided video below highlights the condition of the paint and the interior.

advert.headline: 41k-Mile 2004 Mercedes-Benz CL55 AMG
advert.description:
This 2004 Mercedes-Benz CL55 AMG coupe remained registered in Florida until 2025 and has 41k miles. Finished in black over black leather upholstery, the car is powered by a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, 18″ AMG alloy wheels, a power rear-window sunshade, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Bose surround sound system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this C215 CL55 AMG is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a Pennsylvania title.
The pillarless coupe body is finished in Black (040) and features AMG-specific lower bodywork, in addition to a sunroof, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, heated power-folding side mirrors, and quadruple exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 1982 Jeep CJ-7 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1982 Jeep CJ-7 was modified and refreshed under previous ownership, and it features a repaint in metallic blue over a black interior. Power is provided by a replacement 258ci inline-six linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a twin-stick transfer case. Equipment includes 15″ steel wheels, power steering, manually locking front hubs, body and suspension lift kits, a bikini-style soft top, aftermarket bumpers, a front winch, auxiliary lights, tubular side steps, a roll bar, Bestop bucket seats, a locking center console, a Uniden CB radio, and an aftermarket head unit with Bluetooth capability. This CJ-7 is now offered in Georgia at no reserve by the selling dealer with a clean Florida title.
The truck left the factory finished in Slate Blue Metallic (2C), and it was repainted in its current shade of metallic blue under previous ownership. Exterior details include a bikini-style soft top, aftermarket bumpers, a front winch, auxiliary lights, tubular side steps, front and rear recovery hooks, a whip antenna, a hi-lift jack, and a receiver hitch.

advert.headline: 2006 Porsche Cayman S 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2006 Porsche Cayman S has 60k miles and is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. The car is powered by a 3.4-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and has been fitted with an aftermarket touchscreen infotainment system and a dashcam. Additional equipment includes the Preferred Package, a deployable rear spoiler, fog lights, 18” Cayman S wheels, heated seats, a Bose sound system, and cruise control. This 987.1 Cayman S is now offered in North Carolina by the selling dealer with a clean New York title.
The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (92U) and features fog lights, quarter-panel intakes, a speed-dependent rear spoiler, rain-sensing wipers, and dual exhaust outlets. A June 2025 entry in the Carfax report notes that the car received “minor damage” to the left front, though the selling dealer notes that this is inaccurate. Paint meter readings are displayed in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 2021 BMW R1250GS
advert.description:
This 2021 BMW R1250GS was purchased new by the seller who has ridden it 2k miles. It is finished in black with gray accents and is powered by a liquid-cooled 1,254cc opposed-twin linked with a six-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft. Features include 19″ and 17″ gray-finished alloy wheels, BMW Vario side cases, Brembo ABS disc brakes, LED lights, heated two-up seating, a clear windscreen, heated hand grips, a Telelever front end, a Paralever single-sided swingarm, and both center and side stands. This R1250GS is offered in Washington, D.C. with service records, a coil remover tool, and a Maryland title in the seller’s name.
The bike is finished in black with gray accents and features heated two-up seating, LED lights, a clear windscreen, billet aluminum mirrors, BMW Vario side cases, folding passenger foot pegs, and both center and side stands.

advert.headline: 1986 Volkswagen Scirocco 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1986 Volkswagen Scirocco has 97k miles and is powered by a 1.8-liter inline-four linked to a five-speed manual transaxle. It is finished in Mars Red over gray cloth upholstery and is equipped with quad headlights, dual side mirrors, 13″ alloy wheels, front bucket seats, split folding rear seats, air conditioning, and a Kenwood cassette radio. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this Type 2 Scirocco is now offered with the owner’s manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a Wisconsin title.
The second-generation Scirocco was introduced in 1981 and shared the same wheelbase as the previous model but wore an updated body that was 10″ longer and featured rear hatchback glass bisected by a spoiler. The Karmann-built body of this example is finished in Mars Red, and additional equipment includes quad headlights, black bumpers, and dual side mirrors.

advert.headline: 1964 Land Rover 88 Series IIA
advert.description:
This 1964 Land Rover 88 Series IIA was refurbished around 2019, and it is finished in blue with a removable white hardtop over gray vinyl upholstery. Powered by a 2.25-liter gasoline inline-four linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case, the truck features 15″ steel wheels, a hood-mounted spare tire, a front tow bar, a clevis-pin hitch, seatbelts, center-facing rear bench seats, Stewart-Warner auxiliary gauges, a banjo-style steering wheel, a heater, and a Solex carburetor. The selling dealer acquired the truck in July 2023. This Series IIA is now offered by the selling dealer with a California title.
The truck features aluminum body panels that were repainted in blue in 2019, the seller tells us. The removable hardtop is painted white, and other equipment includes a front tow bar, a folding windshield, fender-mounted side mirrors, a drop-down tailgate, and a clevin-pin hitch. Blemishes in the paint and other imperfections are pictured in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 37k-Mile 1999 GMC Sierra 1500 SLT Extended Cab Z71 4×4
advert.description:
This 1999 GMC Sierra 1500 SLT Extended Cab 4×4 pickup is a Canadian-market example that was imported to the US in March 1999 and remained registered to the original owner in Washington through 2025. Finished in Pewter Metallic over Pewter leather, the truck is powered by a 5.3-liter Vortec V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission, an Autotrac active dual-range transfer case, and a locking rear differential. Equipment includes the Z71 Off-Road Suspension Package, 17″ six-spoke cast-aluminum wheels, and running boards with integrated wheel arch flares in addition to heated power-adjustable front seats, air conditioning, cruise control, and a CD/cassette stereo. Purchased by the seller in January 2026, this GMT800 Sierra 1500 has 37k miles and is offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.
The truck is finished in Pewter Metallic and features a Wideside bed with Z71 decals and running boards with integrated wheel arch flares. Other details include a bug shield, fog lights, front tow hooks, a spray-in bedliner, and a receiver hitch. Photographs of paint meter readings, blemishes, and areas of touch-up paint are pictured in the gallery below. There is a sealed chip in the windshield.

advert.headline: 35k-Mile 2015 Jaguar XF Portfolio AWD
advert.description:
This 2015 Jaguar XF Portfolio is finished in Polaris White over beige leather and is powered by a 340-horsepower supercharged 3.0-liter V6 linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and an all-wheel-drive system. The current owner purchased the car as a Jaguar Approved Certified Pre-Owned vehicle in September 2015, and they have since added approximately 33k of the 35k indicated miles. Equipment includes a Meridian surround-sound system, a heated steering wheel, heated and ventilated front seats, 19″ Aquila wheels, adaptive xenon headlights, and a navigation system. This XF is now offered at no reserve by the seller, a BaT Local Partner , on behalf of the current owner with two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Rhode Island title.
The car is finished in Polaris White (NER), and exterior details include a power sunroof, adaptive xenon headlights, and front and rear parking sensors. Dings are noted on the body, and the rear bumper cover has blemishes.

advert.headline: 33-Years-Family-Owned 1976 Datsun 280Z 4-Speed
advert.description:
This 1976 Datsun 280Z is said to have been purchased by the seller’s father in 1993 and was inherited in 2024. Refinished in red over black vinyl, the car is powered by a 2.8-liter inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission. It rides on 14″ alloy wheels and is further equipped with power-assisted front disc brakes, a left-side mirror, an Edelbrock ignition coil, an aftermarket dash cap, and a cassette stereo. This 280Z is now offered at no reserve with a clean Washington State title in the seller’s name.
The car was repainted red in the early 1990s while still in the care of the seller’s father. Details include a left-side mirror, chrome-finished bumpers, front and rear bumper guards, and a single exhaust outlet. Noted blemishes include faded paint and scratches on the hood. Some of the photos used in the listing and in the gallery below were taken in April 2025.

advert.headline: 2007 Mercedes-Benz SL550
advert.description:
This 2007 Mercedes-Benz SL550 has 80k miles following registration history in Louisiana, Florida, Ohio, and Montana, and it was acquired by the seller on BaT in October 2025 . Work under current ownership included the installation of a panoramic roof panel, tinted front corner markers, revised exhaust resonators, LED license plate and fog lights, and a later-style wood-trimmed steering wheel and shift knob, as well as a replacement ABC suspension accumulator and filter, soft top locking cylinder, trunk lock actuator, headliner, and accessory drive belt. Finished in black over matching leather, the car is powered by a 5.5-liter V8 linked to a seven-speed automatic transmission. It was optioned with the AMG Sport and Premium 1 packages as well as a power-folding hardtop, xenon headlights, 18″ AMG split five-spoke alloy wheels, Keyless Go, heated and ventilated seats, wood veneer trim, a Bose sound system, and COMAND with navigation. This R230 is now offered at no reserve with owner’s manuals, a tool kit, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
The car is finished in Black (040) and features a power-folding convertible hardtop with a panoramic roof panel that was retrofitted under current ownership. LED fog lights and license plate lights were added along with tinted front corner markers, and additional details include xenon headlights, fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, and fender air vents. The AMG Sport Package added a revised front air dam, side skirts, and rear apron. A September 2013 entry in the Carfax report notes “minor damage” to the front, and cracks are present in the lower portion of the front air dam. The locking cylinder for the folding top was replaced in October 2025, along with the trunk lock actuator.

advert.headline: Recaro Sport Seats for Porsche 911
advert.description:
This pair of Recaro seats is upholstered in black leather and features side bolsters and adjustable headrests. Each seat has perforated leather inserts on the backrest and lower cushion along with a sliding mechanism fitted to the base. The seats were previously sold on BaT in February 2022 and were acquired by the selling dealer in 2023. They are now offered at no reserve in San Carlos, California.
These seats are said to be suitable for 1969-1973 models, were reupholstered in black leather under prior ownership, and feature perforated inserts. Additional photos are presented in the gallery.

advert.model: Pages: Divco, Porsche 911s, Reliant Scimitar, and More!
advert.headline: 1959 Ducati 200 Turismo
advert.description:
This 1959 Ducati 200 Turismo is equipped with a 204cc four-stroke single paired with a four-speed transmission and is finished in red and silver over a silver-finished single-downtube frame. The bike rides on 18″ wire-spoke wheels and is further equipped with a Marzocchi fork, drum brakes, a steering damper, a black vinyl bench seat, and a center stand. This Turismo was purchased by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered at no reserve in Florida with a Kansas title.
The bike is finished in red and silver with Turismo graphics over a silver-finished single-downtube open-cradle frame in which the engine is stressed. Equipment includes a contoured 4.5-gallon fuel tank, a black bench seat, a left-side mirror, and a center stand.

advert.headline: 30k-Mile 2009 BMW 328i Sedan
advert.description:
This 2009 BMW 328i sedan has 30k miles following history in New Jersey and remained registered with the second owner from 2014 until 2025. The car is finished in Monaco Blue Metallic over beige leatherette and is powered by a 3.0-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed automatic transmission. Features include a sunroof, 16″ wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, a BMW CD stereo, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This E90 sedan is now offered in New York by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Montana title.
The car is finished in Monaco Blue Metallic (A35) and is equipped with a sunroof, LED taillights, and fog lights. Paintwork was performed on the right quarter panel under previous ownership.

advert.headline: 2014 Porsche Cayenne Diesel Platinum Edition
advert.description:
This 2014 Porsche Cayenne Diesel is a Platinum Edition example that is finished in Mahogany Metallic over an Umber and Light Tartufo leather interior. It is powered by a turbocharged 3.0-liter diesel V6 linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential. Ordered with the Brushed Aluminum Interior Package, the vehicle is further outfitted with a panoramic sunroof, 20″ Cayenne SportDesign II alloy wheels, a back-up camera, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, PCM with navigation, and a Bose sound system. The truck was acquired by the owner in 2022, and service completed since has included replacing the intake manifold gasket, oil cooler seals, coolant hoses, and transmission oil pan gasket. This Cayenne Diesel has 179k miles and is now offered on dealer consignment at no reserve with a clean Oregon title.
The truck is finished in Mahogany Metallic with Platinum Edition-specific trim and features xenon headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as fog lights, a panoramic sunroof, a receiver hitch, and LED taillights. The seller notes a fault with the ParkAssist parking sensors, scratches around the body, and damage to the front bumper cover. The Carfax report lists “minor damage” in September 2022 and January 2025 entries.

advert.headline: 1967 Chevrolet K10 Pickup 4×4 Stepside
advert.description:
This 1967 Chevrolet K10 4×4 Stepside pickup is finished in red and black over gray cloth and is powered by a 327ci V8 linked with a three-speed Turbo Hydramatic automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Additional equipment includes 16″ aftermarket wheels, a sunroof, a wood bed floor, a heater, replacement seats, and a cassette stereo. The truck was acquired by the current owner in August 2025, and recent work included servicing the carburetor and repainting the lower side panels. This K10 is offered in dealer consignment in Texas with a clean North Carolina title.
The truck has been repainted red and black, and equipment includes a Stepside bed, wood bed slats, an aftermarket sunroof, and chrome bumpers. Lower portions of the truck were repainted black in preparation for the sale.

advert.headline: 41-Years-Family-Owned 1940 Ford Deluxe Tudor Sedan
advert.description:
This 1940 Ford Deluxe Tudor sedan was purchased by the seller’s father in 1985, reportedly from the car’s second owner of over two decades. It was later refurbished and is powered by a 221ci flathead V8 mated to a three-speed manual transmission. The car is finished in red over tan cloth, and equipment includes body-color 15″ steel wheels, hydraulic drum brakes, and an electric fuel pump. This ’40 Tudor Sedan is now offered on dealer consignment at no reserve with a Pennsylvania title.
The Tudor sedan bodywork was refinished in red in the 1980s and features and dual chevron taillights, chrome bumpers with guards, and a split rear window. There is checking the paint around the rear license plate as well as paint damage below the fuel filler location. The passenger-side vent window is cracked, and there is delamination at the top of the side window glass.

advert.headline: 2017 Porsche Cayenne S E-Hybrid Platinum Edition
advert.description:
This 2017 Porsche Cayenne S E-Hybrid is a Platinum Edition that is finished in Pupurite Metallic over an Agate Grey leather interior. It is powered by a supercharged 3.0-liter V6 and a synchronous electric motor, both of which are linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a self-locking center differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package Plus as well as LED headlights, a panoramic sunroof, ParkAssist parking sensors, a surround-view camera system, Lane Change Assist, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated rear seats, a heated steering wheel, Porsche Entry & Drive, a Bose sound system, and navigation. This Cayenne S E-Hybrid has 121k miles and is offered by the selling dealer with a clean Montana title.
The truck is finished in Purpurite Metallic and features LED headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as fog lights, LED taillights, ParkAssist parking sensors, a panoramic sunroof, soft-close doors, and black quad exhaust outlets. Scratches are visible on the rear bumper cover. The Carfax report lists “minor damage” in an August 2020 entry.

advert.headline: 2004 Mini Cooper S MC40 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2004 Mini Cooper S MC40 is #987 of 1,000 total examples produced to commemorate the 40th anniversary of Paddy Hopkirk’s 1964 Monte Carlo Rally victory. The car remained in the original owner’s family until December 2025, and it has 67k miles. Finished in Chili Red with a white roof over Space Red and Panther Black leather, the car is powered by a supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Features include 17″ BBS R90 multi-piece alloy wheels, a sport suspension, Dynamic Stability Control, xenon headlights, MC40-specific graphics, a CD stereo, and air conditioning. This R53 Cooper S MC40 is now offered by the selling dealer with owner’s manuals, decals, a clean Carfax report, and a New York title.
The car is finished in Chili Red with a white roof and features the MC40 Package, which included chrome mirror housings and door handles as well as magnetic “37” numbering on the doors and vinyl decals on the hood and quarter panels. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, fog lights, rally-style driving lights, rear GB badging, black wheel arch flares and rocker panels, a roof spoiler, and twin center-exit exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery.

advert.headline: 16×7″ and 16×8″ BBS RA Wheels for Porsche
advert.description:
These 16″ BBS RA wheels measure 7″ and 8″ wide and were produced in West Germany for use on Porsche 911SC and Carrera 3.2 sports cars. They were refinished under prior ownership and acquired by the seller in 2023. The wheels feature single-piece construction, a basketweave-spoke design, and gold centers with polished lips. This set of BBS RA wheels is now offered at no reserve in Lake Havasu City, Arizona, with BBS-branded center caps.
Each five-lug wheel features single-piece construction and a basketweave-spoke design. All four wheels measure 16″ in diameter and are finished in gold with polished lips. BBS-branded center caps are included.

advert.headline: 1978 Chevrolet C10 Scottsdale Pickup Convertible Conversion
advert.description:
This 1978 Chevrolet C10 Scottsdale pickup was modified into a convertible with a removable hardtop under previous ownership. It is powered by a 350ci V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission, and additional features include a hard tonneau cover, shaved door handles, a lowered suspension, a receiver hitch, dual fuel tanks, power steering, power-assisted brakes, 16″ American Racing wheels, and a Pioneer CD stereo. This C10 was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered with a Washington state title.
The truck was converted into a convertible under previous ownership and has a removable hardtop. The body is refinished in yellow with a rear black stripe, and additional features include a Fleetside bed, a hard tonneau cover, shaved door handles, a receiver hitch, dual fuel tanks, dual exhaust outlets, and chrome bumpers.

advert.headline: 1963 Chevrolet C10 Stepside Pickup Project
advert.description:
This 1963 Chevrolet C10 is a short-bed Stepside pickup that was purchased by the seller’s father in 2013 and refinished in red approximately five years ago. The 350ci V8 is not running and is connected to a three-speed automatic transmission that was rebuilt, according to the seller. The interior remains partially unfinished and houses a bench seat trimmed in black and gray cloth, while the body displays rust on the roof, hood, and parts of the rear of the cab. Front disc brakes have been installed along with 18″ Ridler alloy wheels, and additional equipment includes a Holley carburetor, power steering, and Dolphin gauges. This C10 is now being offered as a non-running project by the seller on behalf of their father with a Texas title in the owner’s name.
The body was refinished in red under current ownership and features a Stepside bed with a wood floor as well as dual side mirrors and chrome bumpers. Paint is flaking on the tailgate, and rust perforation is visible in the roof panel along with bubbling on the front of the hood, the rear of the cab, and behind the driver’s door.

advert.headline: 1969 Schwinn Sting-Ray Pea Picker Bicycle
advert.description:
This 1969 Schwinn Sting-Ray is a “Pea Picker” Krate edition bicycle that was refinished in green under prior ownership and was acquired by the seller in 2025. The bike features a cantilever frame, a banana seat supported via a rear spring-loaded sissy bar, and a five-speed drivechain operated by an automotive-style Stik-Shift and a rear derailleur. Additional equipment includes a chrome girder fork, a front drum brake, a high-rise handlebar, chrome wire-spoke wheels, and chrome fenders. This Pea Picker is now offered at no reserve in Goodyear, Arizona.
The Krate was offered in a variety of colors, and this example, dubbed the “Pea Picker,” was refinished in dark green under prior ownership. The bike has a green glitter banana seat with white racing stripes that is supported at the rear by sissy bar shocks. Additional features include a chrome girder fork, Schwinn and Sting-Ray script, a rear reflector, a license plate holder, chrome fenders, and a side stand. A chip in the frame paint is captured in the gallery.

advert.headline: 2012 Land Rover Range Rover HSE Luxury
advert.description:
This 2012 Land Rover Range Rover HSE Luxury remained under the care of its original owner in California until 2025. Finished in black over black leather upholstery, the truck is powered by a 5.0-liter AJ133 V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes an electronic center differential, a sunroof, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated rear seats, a surround-view camera system, cruise control, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This L322 Range Rover HSE Luxury is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a California title.
The truck is finished in Sumatra Black and features xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, a sunroof, a rear window wiper, and parking sensors. The adaptive headlight function does not work, and there are paint chips on the forward-facing surfaces.

advert.headline: Neon Shelby Signs and Wall Clock
advert.description:
These three reproduction Shelby Cobra signs and a wall clock are illuminated by multi-color neon tubes powered by 120-volt wiring. Each is supported by a metal frame with hanging provisions. They were acquired by the seller circa 2024, and the collection is now offered at no reserve in Fort Lauderdale, Florida
The Shelby vertical sign has a red background with blue, black, and yellow accents and is about 47″ tall by 10″ wide by 2″ deep

advert.headline: 1979 Lancia Beta Coupe 2000 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1979 Lancia Beta Coupe 2000 received a rebuild of its 1,995cc inline-four in 2011, as well as a prior repaint in red, before being purchased by the seller in 2025. Additional features include Mitsubishi Starion-sourced front seats clad in black leather along with a rebuilt five-speed manual transaxle, four-wheel disc brakes, a Weber 34DAT carburetor, a JVC radio, Pioneer speakers, and 14″ eight-spoke light alloy wheels. This Beta coupe is now offered at no reserve with service records, spare parts, and a clean Oregon title in the seller’s name.
The Pininfarina-designed body was previously white and has been refinished in red. It features a front-hinged engine cover, fog lights, and dual exhaust outlets. There is rust in the lower quarter panels, near the body seams on the rockers, and in other various spots. Some rust repair has been performed, but the seller states that more is required. Other imperfections can be viewed in the gallery.

advert.headline: 2015 Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6X6 Brabus B63S-700
advert.description:
This 2015 Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6×6 is one of approximately 100 built by Magna Steyr in Graz, Austria, between 2013 and 2015, and it was delivered new to its first owner in Dubai before being brought to Canada, where it was modified with the Brabus G700 package. It was leased by the current owner in 2024 and imported to the US under a “show or display” exemption in September 2025. The truck wears a satin white wrap and features carbon-fiber intake snorkels, fender flares, and exterior trim along with a wood-paneled cargo bed. Power comes from a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V8 linked to an AMG Speedshift 7G-Tronic seven-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, three portal axles, and five electronic locking differentials. The engine is equipped with Brabus turbochargers as well as a valve-controlled exhaust system and dual fuel tanks, and the truck rides on 18″ Hutchinson beadlock wheels with Öhlins shocks and a central tire inflation system. Heated and ventilated bucket seats are upholstered in Lanarit Blue quilted leather, and additional appointments include a Harman Kardon sound system, a rear seat entertainment setup, and carbon-fiber trim. This G700-specification G63 AMG 6×6 has 9k miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with NHTSA “show or display” paperwork, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
Based on a three-axle military version of the Geländewagen , the G63 AMG 6×6 weighs more than 4.5 tons and offers 18″ of ground clearance. This example wears a 3M satin white wrap over Designo Magnetite Black Metallic paint, and exposed carbon-fiber is present on the hood scoop, intake snorkels, fender vents, grille and headlight bezels, fender vents, mirror caps, and intake snorkels. The Brabus front lower bumper incorporates daytime running lights, and additional equipment includes Brabus badging, xenon headlights, LED auxiliary lighting, power-operated side steps, tubular rear bumpers, and an integrated chrome rear roll bar.

advert.headline: 3,300-Kilometer 1988 Lamborghini Countach 5000 QV
advert.description:
This black-on-black 1988 Lamborghini Countach is one of approximately 610 examples of the 5000 Quattrovalvole variant produced between 1985 and 1988. Sold new through Il Cavallino, Inc. of Dix Hills, New York, in October 1987, chassis LA12234 is said to have remained in the collection of its original owner until its 2024 acquisition by the selling dealer. Now showing 3,300 kilometers (~2,100 miles), the car is powered by a 5.2-liter quad-cam V12 linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It rides on gold-finished 15″ Ruote OZ wheels and features pop-up headlights, scissor doors, and a V-shaped rear wing. Inside, a Raid steering wheel is paired with a gated shifter and accompanied by fixed-back bucket seats, air conditioning, and an Alpine stereo. This Countach 5000 QV is now offered by 1600veloce— a BaT Local Partner —with manufacturer’s literature, a tool kit, and a clean New York State title.
Introduced as a prototype in 1971, the Countach was designed by Bertone’s Marcello Gandini with angular wedge-shaped styling and scissor doors. The car features a tubular steel space frame under aluminum bodywork as well as NACA ducts aft of the doors and air intakes above the rear quarters.

advert.headline: 2019 Porsche 911 GT2 RS Weissach Manthey Performance Package
advert.description:
This 2019 Porsche 911 GT2 RS was optioned from the factory with the $18k Weissach Package and was modified in October 2025 by Porsche of Nashville with a Manthey Racing performance kit, which features revised aero components, an enlarged intercooling system, a four-way adjustable suspension, braided brake lines, staggered magnesium wheels with rear carbon-fiber aerodiscs, a carbon-fiber underbody, and a carbon-fiber deck lid. It is finished in GT Silver Metallic over black leather and red Alcantara upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8L flat-six linked with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The car is further equipped with the Sport Chrono Package, carbon-ceramic brakes with yellow calipers, a front-axle lift system, a Bose sound system, automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. Acquired by the current owner in 2023, this 991 GT2 RS now has 4k miles and is offered with removed parts, a copy of the window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Tennessee title in the seller’s name.
Weight savings were targeted with the GT2 RS program, and Porsche fitted multiple carbon-fiber components including the hood, front fender vents, side intakes, and side mirrors. The Weissach Package reduces weight further through the use of carbon fiber for the roof panel and the anti-roll bars, while NACA ducts in the front trunk lid aid in brake cooling. This example is finished in GT Silver Metallic and features bi-xenon headlights, auto-dimming mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. Manthey Racing aero components were installed in October 2025, including a revised rear diffuser and front canards as well as a carbon-fiber decklid and spoiler, rear diffuser, and swan-neck-hinged rear wing. Paint protection film has been applied to the full body.

advert.headline: One-Owner, 3,900-Mile 2006 Ford GT
advert.description:
This 2006 Ford GT was initially delivered to Riverside Ford in Macon, Georgia, and was purchased new by the current owner. The car is one of 2,011 built for the model year and now has 3,900 miles. Finished in Midnight Blue over Ebony leather, it was optioned with painted white stripes, BBS wheels, gray-painted brake calipers, and a McIntosh stereo system. Power comes from a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 linked with a six-speed manual gearbox and a helical limited-slip differential, and additional equipment includes Brembo brakes, HID headlights, a front splitter, a rear diffuser, and air conditioning. This Ford GT is offered on dealer consignment in Texas with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a Ford GT certificate, service records, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.
The GT took inspiration from the GT40 racing cars of the 1960s and features an extruded-aluminum space frame, roll-bonded floors, and aluminum body panels. This example is one of 190 finished in Midnight Blue for the model year and features optional over-the-top white stripes and Ford GT graphics, HID headlights, fog lights, side air intakes, a vented hood, a front splitter, a rear diffuser, and a dual center-exit exhaust system.

advert.headline: Jeff Hayes–Modified 1963 Chevrolet Corvette Split-Window Coupe
advert.description:
This 1963 Chevrolet Corvette split-window coupe is a custom build from Jeff Hayes Customs in Indiana that was completed in 2025, and it is comprised of a Daytona Blue body mounted to a fabricated Art Morrison chassis. The 6.2-liter LS3 V8 is linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a reinforced solid rear axle. Behind the Schott knockoff wheels are Wilwood disc brakes and a coilover suspension with tubular control arms, and further details include rack-and-pinion steering, polished headers, a power-operated hood, flip-up headlights, and a button-top shifter. The cockpit is trimmed in Caramel Nappa leather and appointed with a teakwood steering wheel, Vintage Air climate control, Classic Instruments gauges, illuminated sill plates, carbon-fiber elements, and a retro-look radio. This C2 split-window coupe is now offered on consignment by the seller, a BaT Local Partner , with an Indiana title.
The fiberglass body is finished in Daytona Blue (916), and the seller tells us the body retains its factory paint finish. It is mounted to a custom Art Morrison chassis, and details include flip-up headlights, fender vents, quad taillights, chrome bumperettes, and a power-operated hood.

advert.headline: John Oates’ 1960 Porsche 356B Emory Special Cabriolet
advert.description:
This 1960 356B left the factory as a cabriolet and was rebuilt and modified as an Emory Special cabriolet by Emory Motorsports between 2016 and 2018 for the seller, Rock and Roll Hall of Fame musician John Oates. Oates commissioned the car to celebrate his 70th birthday and took initial delivery during Rennsport Reunion VI at the Weathertech Raceway Laguna Seca. Power is provided by a 2.4-liter Emory-Rothsport flat-four that combines Porsche 911 internals and bespoke components housed in a custom-cast case and features dual 48mm Weber carburetors and twin-plug ignition. Shifting is via a four-speed manual transaxle, and further equipment includes 16” billet aluminum wheels, four-wheel ventilated disc brakes, PEP adjustable shock absorbers, a 911-style rear suspension setup, and front and rear sway bars. Finished in custom blend of Graphite Grey Metallic, the car’s bodywork incorporates a lowered removable hardtop with louvered windows as well as an increased windshield rake, driving lamps, and a louvered decklid. Inside, the Speedster-style bucket seats are trimmed in cognac leather and accompanied by Simpson harnesses, a roll bar, and a wood-rimmed steering wheel. This Emory Special cabriolet is now offered with build photos and a clean Tennessee title that lists the vehicle as a 1961 model year.
Previously finished in red, the roadster was stripped to bare metal, mounted to a rotisserie, and received bodywork and rust repairs by Emory Motorsports. The windshield rake angle was increased and the removable hardtop was lowered to fit. Chassis stiffening was added, and a repaint in a lacquer-based custom blend of Graphite Grey Metallic, featuring bronze and black highlights, was subsequently carried out by Little Shop of Kustoms. The hood handle has been deleted, and additional features include GT-style bumpers, H4-style headlamps, Marchal fog lamps with amber bulbs, a through-hood fuel filler, a door-mounted left mirror, louvered Lexan rear quarter windows, inverted decklid louvers, and dual black-finished exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 1,200-Mile 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 RS Weissach
advert.description:
This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 RS was optioned with the $33,520 Weissach Package, which reduced weight through the use of a carbon-composite roof panel, front lid, anti-roll bars, and interior trim. Now showing 1,200 miles, the car is finished in Arctic Grey over black leather and Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked to a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle and an electronically locking differential. Features include a front-axle lift system, rear-wheel steering, Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, forged magnesium wheels, LED headlights, an active swan-neck rear wing, rear parking sensors, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, Guards Red seat belts, and Porsche Communication Management linked to a Bose sound system. Previously sold on BaT in March 2024 , this 992 GT3 RS was acquired by the selling dealer in California in 2026 and is now offered at no reserve with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
The body is finished in Arctic Grey (LM7K) with black side graphics. Exterior details include lightweight glass and a carbon-fiber front trunk lid, roof panel, and swan-neck rear wing with drag-reduction (DRS) functionality as well as LED headlights, vented fenders, side air intakes, a rear fog light, rear parking sensors, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 3,900-Mile 2016 Porsche 911 R
advert.description:
This 2016 Porsche 911 R is #740 of 991 examples manufactured during a single model year, and its body has been fitted with a “BP World Record” livery, paying homage to multiple endurance records set by the 1967 911 R at Italy’s Monza circuit. It is finished in white with red stripes over Tarpan Brown leather and Pepita-style cloth upholstery, and it is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The car is further equipped with 20″ center-lock GT3 alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes with yellow calipers, LED headlights with PDLS, a speed-activated rear spoiler, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, a Bose sound system, a front-axle lift, PCM with navigation, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the current owner in 2025, this 991 911 R has 3,900 miles and is now offered in California on dealer consignment by the selling dealer, a BaT Local Partner , with a build sheet, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
The 911 R was a limited-production variant developed in the spirit of the 1967 homologation special of the same name. Styling was based on that of the contemporary 911 GT3, with construction elements borrowed from the GT3 RS including a magnesium roof panel and a carbon-fiber hood. The model also featured a carbon-fiber deck lid and front fenders, a model-specific front lip and rear underbody splitter, a retractable spoiler, and an aluminum grille. This example is finished in white with red stripes and a “BP World Record” livery, and additional details include LED headlights with PDLS, fog lights, clear side markers, carbon-fiber mirror caps, and dual exhaust outlets. Imperfections are highlighted in the gallery.

advert.headline: 11k-Mile 1999 Lamborghini Diablo VT Roadster
advert.description:
This 1999 Lamborghini Diablo VT roadster is believed to have remained with two owners in Las Vegas, Nevada, through 2021 before being sold by the selling dealer to their client. Finished in Rosso Smalto over Crema leather with red piping, the car is powered by a 5.7-liter V12 linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a Viscous Traction all-wheel-drive system with front and rear limited-slip differentials. It rides on an adjustable suspension and is fitted with 18″ multi-piece alloy wheels over Brembo disc brakes. Further equipment includes fixed headlights, scissor doors, a rear wing, and a removable hardtop along with fixed-back bucket seats, a gated shifter, automatic climate control, and an Alpine CD stereo. Now showing under 11k miles, this Diablo VT Roadster is offered on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a tool kit, and a California title.
The Diablo underwent a mid-cycle refresh for 1999 and received fixed composite headlights sourced from the contemporary Z32 Nissan 300ZX. This example is finished in Rosso Smalto and features a removable hardtop that stores above the engine compartment. A “disegno Marcello Gandini” badge appears ahead of the right-rear wheel, and further details include Hella front fog lights, scissor doors, and a rear wing. The selling dealer notes scratches on the front air dam as well as scrapes in the paint near where the hardtop meets the decklid.

advert.headline: 2025 Porsche 911 Turbo 50 Years
advert.description:
This 2025 Porsche is #395 of 1,974 911 Turbo 50 Years examples produced worldwide, all of which link a Turbo S-specification twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six with an eight-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and all-wheel drive. This example is finished in Chalk over black leather and Tartan cloth upholstery and is equipped with 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels, Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB), a surround-view camera system, a front-axle lift system, Remote ParkAssist, Porsche InnoDrive with Adaptive Cruise Control and Active Lane Keeping, heated power-adjustable front seats, a Burmester sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. Acquired by the seller in October 2025, this 992.1 Turbo 50 Years has 438 miles and is now offered in Texas with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.
The 911 Turbo 50 Years is based on the 911 Turbo S and was built to commemorate 50 years of the 911 Turbo, adopting design touches from past 911 Turbo models including decals inspired by the 1973 911 RSR Turbo as well as rear decklid inlays, a fuel cap, and a Porsche crest all finished in Turbonite, a new color for Turbo models. Additionally, they were equipped with an Anthracite Gray-finished rear wing, lower fascia, mirror base, and air intake grilles plus door LED projectors and a rear decklid grille badge that showcase a turbocharger design.

advert.headline: 2026 Porsche 911 GT3
advert.description:
This 2026 Porsche 911 GT3 was ordered new by the seller from Porsche Livermore in California, and was specified in Lugano Blue over black Race-Tex and leather upholstery with Shark Blue stitching and seat belts. The car is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked to a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus electronically locking differential, and it rides on Satin Black-finished 20″ and 21″ GT3 center-lock alloy wheels. The interior is equipped with a GT Sport steering wheel and the optional heated 18-way Adaptive Sport Seats Plus front seats, Chrono package, and Bose surround-sound system. Further equipment includes Porsche Active Suspension Management, a front-axle lift system, rear-axle steering, Matrix Design LED headlights, a swan-neck rear wing, and an extended range fuel tank. This 992.2 GT3 has 513 miles and is offered with a build sheet, a window sticker, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a California title.
The car was specified in Lugano Blue, and exterior details include a swan-neck rear wing, Matrix Design LED headlights, black window trim, an Exclusive Design fuel cap, and a rear diffuser with twin center-mounted exhaust outlets. The seller tells us that paint protection film has been applied to the front end.

advert.headline: 22k-Mile 1996 Porsche 911 Turbo
advert.description:
This 1996 Porsche 911 Turbo was initially delivered to Tom Wood Porsche of Indianapolis, Indiana, and it was purchased by the current owner in 2018. The car shows 22k miles and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential. Finished in Arena Red Metallic over Classic Grey supple leather, the car is equipped with a fixed rear spoiler, a power sunroof, 18″ Technology hollow-spoke wheels, KW Variant 3 coilovers, heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Porsche Classic stereo. This 993 Turbo is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment by a Local Partner , with a window sticker, a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, the owner’s manuals, service records, the removed factory stereo, a clean Carfax report, and an Arizona title.
The 993 Turbo featured wider bodywork, revised bumper covers, and a fixed rear spoiler to accommodate top-mount intercoolers when compared with the standard 993 coupe. This example is finished in Arena Red Metallic (84S) and features integrated fog lights, a power sunroof, a rear window wiper, and polished exhaust outlets. The front lip was replaced in March 2015, and full-body paint-protection film was applied in November 2021.

advert.headline: 451-Mile 2022 Lamborghini Huracan EVO RWD
advert.description:
This 2022 Lamborghini Huracán EVO RWD was purchased new by the seller through O’Gara Coach in Beverly Hills, California, and now has 451 miles. Finished in Grigio Telesto over Nero Ade leather with orange stitching and accents, the car is powered by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Factory-specified options included the High Gloss Black Style, Life Style, and Driver packs along with Sportivo cabin trim. The car is further equipped with 20″ Narvi wheels, carbon-ceramic disc brakes, and a front-end lift system as well as a Lamborghini Sensonum sound system, a smartphone interface, and heated and power-adjustable seats.
