This Huracán EVO RWD is now offered with a window sticker, accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.
The car is finished in pearl effect Grigio Telesto, a $14k option. The Life Style Pack added a louvered transparent engine cover, while the High-Gloss Black Style Pack specified a high-gloss black finish on the front fascia, rear upper panel, engine bonnet air vent frames, twin exhaust outlets, and side engine air vent frames. Additional equipment includes LED lighting, power-folding side mirrors, parking sensors, and an integrated rear spoiler.

advert.headline: 1957 Mercedes-Benz 300Sc Einspritzmotor Roadster
advert.description:
This 1957 Mercedes-Benz 300Sc is one of 53 roadster examples manufactured between 1956 and 1958. The car was once owned by ex-Blue Angels pilot and television producer E. Duke Vincent and was refurbished prior to being acquired by the selling dealer in 2025. It is powered by a fuel-injected 3.0-liter M199 inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission and is finished in Tobacco Brown over cream leather. Equipment includes four-wheel independent suspension, 15″ steel wheels with hubcaps, driving lamps, a Becker Mexico radio, a tan convertible top, a rear bench seat, and a wood veneer dashboard. This W188 Einspritzmotor roadster is now offered in North Salem, New York, by the selling dealer with spare parts, literature, fitted luggage, a tool roll, and a clean California title.
A successor to the 300S, the 300Sc debuted in 1955 with a revised M199 engine, direct fuel injection, and a single-joint cross shaft axle with a low pivot. The hand-built sporting version of the four-door 300 series rode on a wheelbase 150mm shorter than the sedan variant. It was built in three configurations including a coupe, a cabriolet, a roadster, the latter of which featured a lighter, fully retractable soft top without the cabriolet’s coach bars.

advert.headline: 15k-Mile 1998 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1998 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe shows 15k miles, and it was specified in Arctic Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery and with the Motor Sound Package. Powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, the car features 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, a sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, cruise control, power-adjustable front seats, a CDR-210 stereo, and air conditioning. Recently acquired by the selling dealer in 2026, this 993 C2S is offered in California with a clean Carfax report and a clean Indiana title.
The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera. This example is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (L92U) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring
advert.description:
This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring is a Canadian-market car with 3,800 miles, and it was optioned with the $17k CAD Exclusive Manufaktur Leather Interior, which houses heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats trimmed in Cognac leather. Powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle, the car is further equipped with an Agate Gray Metallic exterior finish, an electronically locking differential, the Chrono Package, LED headlights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, rear-axle steering, 20″ and 21″ center-locking wheels, a front-axle lift system, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management. This 992 GT3 Touring was acquired by the seller in 2025 and is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a Florida title.
The GT3 Touring package includes a revised decklid with a mesh grille as well as a retractable speed-activated rear spoiler in place of the raised wing found on the standard GT3. This example is finished in Agate Gray Metallic and has LED headlights with PDLS, a rear fog light, auto-dimming mirrors, Exclusive Design taillights, rear parking sensors, puddle light projectors, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 1968 Ferrari 365 GT 2+2
advert.description:
This 1968 Ferrari 365 GT 2+2 is one of approximately 800 examples built over just over three years of production. Chassis 11705 was sold new through Motor S.A.S. di Carla Allegretti in Rome, Italy, and was later imported to the US in 1973. It underwent a color change from blue to red in addition to mechanical work as part of a refurbishment completed circa 2006. Power is provided by a 4.4-liter Colombo V12 that breathes through triple Weber carburetors, while shifting is through a five-speed manual transmission linked with a limited-slip differential. The car wears yellow-lens fog lamps and is equipped with a four-wheel independent suspension, power-assisted steering, servo-assisted ventilated disc brakes, and 15″ Borrani knock-off wire wheels. Inside, 2+2 seating trimmed in beige Connolly leather is accompanied by a wood-rimmed steering wheel, Veglia Borletti instrumentation, and a Becker push-button radio. Work following the current owner’s acquisition in 2019 is said to have involved servicing the air conditioning system. This 365 GT 2+2 is now offered on dealer consignment by the selling dealer— a BaT Local Partner —with a Marcel Massini report, an owner’s manual, vehicle literature, a tool kit, spare parts, and a New York State registration listing the car as a 1969 model.
The 365 GT 2+2 model was introduced at the 1967 Paris Motor Show featuring Pininfarina coachwork with an overall length of almost five meters. This example underwent a color change from blue to red as part of the aforementioned refurbishment completed around 2006. It features split front bumpers with integrated turn signals as well as a wraparound rear bumper with black overriders. Yellow-lens fog lamps have been added up front, and further details include a retractable antenna, dual side mirrors, and polished quad exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 1967 Shelby Mustang GT500
advert.description:
This 1967 Shelby Mustang GT500 fastback is one of 2,048 examples produced for the model year and was shipped to Sexton Ford Sales on March 22, 1967. The car was restored in the 1990s and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2026. It is finished in Dark Moss Green over black vinyl and is powered by a replacement 428ci FE V8 linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a Shelby-specific roll bar, functional hood scoops, a rear spoiler, front disc brakes, power steering, 15″ five-spoke Magstar alloy wheels, a folding rear bench seat, and an AM radio. This GT500 is now offered in New York by 1600veloce , a BaT Local Partner , with a Marti Report, a car cover, and a clean Pennsylvania title.
The car was restored by Greg Adams in the 1990s and is finished in Dark Moss Green with dual white stripes and GT500 side stripes. Exterior details include a ducktail rear spoiler, fender extensions, air scoops on the sail and quarter panels, a fiberglass ventilated hood with a ram-air scoop, hood lock cables, inboard grille-mounted hi-beams, and dual exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 2025 Cadillac Escalade-V AWD Hennessey H1000
advert.description:
This 2025 Cadillac Escalade-V was modified by Hennessey Performance of Sealy, Texas, with their H1000 package for the 6.2-liter V8, which added a revised supercharger, pulleys, camshaft, throttle body, cylinder heads, valve springs, lifters, and push rods. The truck is finished in Black Raven over Jet Black leather, and it is also equipped with Satin Graphite-finished 24″ alloy wheels, a 10-speed automatic transmission, Air Ride Adaptive Suspension, Magnetic Ride Control, power-deployable running boards, a Super Cruise semi-autonomous driving system, Night Vision system, heated second-row captain’s chairs, and heated, ventilated, and power-adjustable front seats. Purchased by the current owner in 2025, the truck now has 5k miles. This T1XL Escalade-V is offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, a Hennessey build sheet, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.
The Escalade-V features mesh front grilles and quadruple exhaust outlets along with revised front and rear fascias as compared to the standard Escalade. This example is finished in Black Raven, and exterior details include power-deployable running boards, a hands-free power tailgate, a rear spoiler, a roof rack, and Hennessey H1000 badging.

advert.model: Dodge Challenger SRT Demon & Super Stock
advert.headline: 13-Mile 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Demon 170
advert.description:
This 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Demon 170 is #2,691 of approximately 3,300 examples built for the model year, and it now has 13 miles. Purchased new by the seller from Santa Cruz Dodge in California, it is powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi High-Output V8 producing up to 1,025 horsepower and 945 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels via a TorqueFlite eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Pitch Black over black Alcantara and Laguna leather, the car is equipped with the Premium Group equipment package, a sunroof, Air-Catcher HID headlights, an Air-Grabber hood, a front splitter, an SRT Performance rear spoiler, flared quarter panels, a “Last Call” under-hood plaque, four-piston Brembo brake calipers, 18″ front and 17″ rear forged aluminum wheels, heated and ventilated front seats, dual-zone climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation. This SRT Demon 170 is now offered in Oklahoma with a Demon decanter set, a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.
Dodge released seven different Last Call special editions for the 2023 model year to celebrate the end of production of the Charger and Challenger, and the Demon 170 was the final special edition variant. This example is finished in Pitch Black (PX8) and features an Air-Grabber hood with “Alcohol Injected” lettering on the hood-scoop bezel. Other exterior details include a sunroof, a front splitter that has retained its yellow scuff guards, Air-Catcher HID headlights, flared rear quarter panels, dual exhaust outlets, and an SRT Performance rear spoiler with an integrated rearview camera.

advert.headline: 2000 Nissan Skyline GT-R V-Spec II
advert.description:
This 2000 Nissan Skyline GT-R is one of 1,855 V-Spec II examples produced and was imported to the US by the current owner in October 2025. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.6L RB26DETT inline-six that sends power to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transmission, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential. It is finished in white over black cloth and is further equipped with Brembo brakes, Super HICAS rear-axle steering, 18″ six-spoke forged alloy wheels, xenon headlights, a carbon-fiber hood, a rear wing, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, a NISMO instrument cluster, and a Kenwood CD stereo. This R34 Skyline GT-R is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner in Huntington Beach, California, with import documents and a Montana title.
The car is finished in white (QM1), and exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, power-folding side mirrors, a carbon-fiber hood with a NACA duct, a rear wing, a front splitter, and an integrated carbon-fiber rear diffuser.

advert.headline: 12k-Mile 2007 Ferrari F430 Spider 6-Speed Conversion
advert.description:
This 2007 Ferrari F430 is a Rosso Corsa-finished Spider that has 12k miles through the seller’s purchase in 2021, and its six-speed transaxle was converted to manual operation in 2021 by European Auto Group of Round Rock, Texas. Powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8, the car is further equipped with beige leather upholstery, Novitec carbon-fiber intakes, a black convertible soft top, 19″ Challenge alloy wheels, a carbon-fiber rear grille, an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, cross-drilled and ventilated brake rotors, rear parking sensors, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, power-adjustable Daytona-style bucket seats, carbon-fiber interior trim, a Bose sound system, a CD stereo, navigation, a gated shifter, and automatic climate control. The tires and battery were replaced in preparation for the sale. This F430 Spider is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.
The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa and has a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, rear parking sensors, a carbon-fiber rear grille, and quad exhaust tips exiting on either side of the rear diffuser. The secondary hydraulic cylinders for the soft top were rebuilt in February 2024. An imperfection is noted on the soft top.

advert.headline: 2024 Audi RS6 Avant Performance
advert.description:
This 2024 Audi RS6 Avant Performance has 9k miles and was optioned from the factory with the RS Design Package Plus in addition to the Matte Carbon, Executive, and Driver Assistance packages. It is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.0L mild-hybrid V8 linked with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and Quattro all-wheel drive, and it is finished in Ascari Blue Metallic over black leather upholstery. The car is further equipped with an RS Sport suspension with Dynamic Ride Control, an RS Sport exhaust system, LED Matrix-Design Laser headlights, a panoramic roof, parking sensors, power soft-closing doors, 22″ Y-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front RS sport seats, heated rear seats, a head-up display, a surround-view camera system, adaptive cruise control, and Audi MMI Touch infotainment with Navigation Plus. This C8 RS6 Avant Performance was purchased by the seller in 2024 and is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a photocopy of the window sticker, service records, spare parts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Ascari Blue Metallic with black trim and matte carbon-fiber accents. Additional details include Matrix-Design LED headlights with Audi laser light and high beam assist as well as a panoramic roof, front and rear parking sensors, power soft-closing doors, LED taillights, surround-view cameras, window tint, and a power-operated liftgate. Paint protection film has been applied to portions of the exterior.

advert.headline: 5k-Mile 2020 McLaren 570S Spider
advert.description:
This 2020 McLaren 570S Spider is finished in Special McLaren Orange over Carbon Black Alcantara with orange accents and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 linked to a seven-speed SSG automatic transaxle. It has under 5k miles and was optioned with the Luxury Pack, the MSO Black Pack, a front-axle lift system, lightweight forged alloy wheels, orange brake calipers, and carbon-fiber interior trim. Additional equipment includes a power-retractable hardtop, soft-close dihedral doors, navigation, a Bowers & Wilkins sound system, and heated sport seats. This 570S was acquired by the seller in 2020 and is now offered with an owner’s manual, a car cover, two keys, a trickle charger, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.
The 570S features aluminum bodywork over a carbon-fiber MonoCell, and this example is finished in Special McLaren Orange with gloss-black trim added as a part of the optional MSO Black Pack. Exterior equipment includes a power-retractable hardtop and soft-close dihedral doors along with LED lighting, a rearview camera, parking sensors, and dual stealth-finish exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to parts of the exterior. There is a crack in the hardtop trim above the left window.

advert.headline: 3,200-Mile 2007 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2007 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe has 3,200 miles and was ordered with PCCB, the Sport Chrono Package, a locking rear differential, deviated stitching, a thicker steering wheel, and body-color-painted Adaptive Sport Seat backs and trim. The car is finished in Carrara White over Black Full leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. It remained with the original owner in California until 2025, and the seller purchased it in December 2025. This 997.1 Turbo coupe is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Carrara White (B9A) with an optional matching front spoiler, front air intake trim, and side skirts. Other exterior details comprise a power sunroof, bi-xenon headlights, side air intakes, and flared quarter panels. The seller notes scrapes on the underside of the front bumper cover and a chip in the right exhaust finisher.

advert.headline: Quint Motorcars/Gullwing Cars 300SL Gullwing Replica
advert.description:
This Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing replica was reportedly partially produced by Quint Motorcars in the 1980s before being completed by Tony Ostermeier’s Gullwing Cars of Gardena, California, circa 1990. It subsequently underwent a refurbishment in 2009 before it was purchased by the selling dealer in 2023. The car wears fiberglass bodywork finished in silver over a shortened 1982 Chevrolet Corvette chassis, and it retains the donor car’s 350ci V8 and four-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes an Edelbrock 650-cfm carburetor, an aluminum radiator, Bilstein shocks, VB&P fiberglass transverse monoleaf springs, power-assisted steering, four-wheel disc brakes, and a Wilwood master cylinder. Inside, the low-backed bucket seats are trimmed in black leather, and amenities include air conditioning, a Lokar shifter, VDO gauges, a Nardi steering wheel on a tilt-down hub, a Becker Mexico radio, and a custom hidden stereo system. This 300SL coupe replica is now offered with a pair of fitted suitcases, service records, and a Florida title listing the car as a 1955 Mercedes-Benz.
Quint Motorcars of Waterbury, Connecticut, was founded by Herman Quint, a German-born engineer who made the body molds for his 300SL replicas from his personal car, chassis 5500771. The company’s first 20 replicas were reportedly built utilizing a C3 Corvette-sourced chassis that was shortened by 3″ and reinforced before switching to Mercedes-Benz-sourced running gear later in the production run. The brightwork, badges, and interior components on this example are said to have been sourced from Gullwing Cars, which also handled the car’s final assembly. That company was founded in the late 1980s by former Mercedes-Benz employee Anton “Tony” Ostermeier. Gullwing Cars’ 300SL replicas also utilized bodywork based on a factory 300SL to create patterns for their builds.

advert.headline: 1978 Porsche 930 Turbo
advert.description:
This 1978 Porsche 930 Turbo is finished in silver over black leather and is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle. It has a sunroof, a tea tray rear spoiler, fog lights, aftermarket exhaust components, and 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels along with front sport seats, a cassette stereo, power windows, and R134a-based air conditioning. Acquired by the current owner in 2022, this 930 Turbo is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with an owner’s manual and a clean California title.
The car is finished in silver and features a sunroof, front fog lamps, headlight washers, dual side mirrors, rear stone guards, rear bumperettes, a front spoiler, and a “tea tray” rear spoiler. The sunroof was repaired in 2024. Photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe 6-Speed
advert.description:
This black-on-black 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe was optioned with Aerokit II front and rear spoilers in addition to the Motor Sound Package, M030 sport suspension, and a limited-slip differential. It was purchased by the current owner in 2021 from its long-term prior owner and shows 81k miles, following registration history in California, Oregon, and Arizona. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is equipped with 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, a power-operated sunroof, cruise control, a CDR-210 stereo, power-adjustable front seats, and air conditioning. The tires were replaced in preparation for the sale. This 993 C2S is offered on consignment by the selling dealer, a BaT Local Partner , with a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.
The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera. This example is finished in black and was optioned with Aerokit II front and rear spoilers. Additional exterior details include headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, and dual exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 7k-Mile 2017 Acura NSX
advert.description:
This 2017 Acura NSX has 7k miles and has been fitted with a Science of Speed ECU tune as well as downpipes with high-flow catalytic converters. It is finished in silver over black leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter V6 mated to three electric motors, a nine-speed dual-clutch transaxle, and Acura’s Super Handling All-Wheel-Drive system. The car was optioned with “Jewel Eye” LED headlights, front and rear spoilers, side-skirt extensions, 19″ front and 20″ rear interwoven alloy wheels, carbon-fiber exterior and interior accents, carbon-ceramic brakes, a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, dual-zone automatic climate control, an ELS sound system, heated power-adjustable seats, and cruise control. This NC1 NSX was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered in California with the owner’s manual, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Oklahoma title.
The car is finished in silver with a carbon-fiber roof, rear diffuser, front splitter, side skirt extensions, and rear spoiler. Additional details include “Jewel Eye” LED headlights, pop-out door handles, side air intakes, front and rear parking sensors, and center quad exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the front end, per the seller.

advert.headline: 34k-Mile 1998 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S Coupe 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1998 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S left the factory in black over black Supple leather upholstery, and it was optioned with Aerokit front and rear spoilers, a Hi-Fi sound system, and Nokia Digital Sound Processing (DSP). The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, a sunroof, brake cooling ducts, cruise control, a cassette stereo, and air conditioning. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2026, this 993 C4S has 34k miles and is offered in California with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title.
The 993 C4S features wider rear bodywork in comparison with the standard Carrera, as well as a front air dam derived from the contemporary Turbo. This example left the factory with Aerokit front and rear spoilers and is finished in Black (741). Brake cooling ducts have been installed in place of the fog lights, and additional exterior details include heated power-adjustable mirrors, a sunroof, and dual exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 3,700-Mile 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked to a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring. Finished in white over black leather and Race-Tex, the car is further equipped with the Sport Chrono Package, 20″ Cayman GT4 wheels, bi-xenon headlights, rear wing risers, European-style side marker lights, carbon-fiber bucket seats and interior trim, and Porsche Communication management with navigation. It was previously listed by the consigning dealer, a BaT Local Partner , on the site in December 2024 , and was acquired by its current owner later that same year. This 718 Cayman GT4 has 3,700 miles and is offered with a DME report, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.
The car is finished in White (C9A) and has been fitted with clear European-style side marker lights and aftermarket rear wing risers. Further details include bi-xenon headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System (PDLS) as well as rear ParkAssist, clear taillights, an aluminum-look fuel cap, side air intakes, and power-folding and auto-dimming side mirrors. Paint protection film has been applied to the front bumper cover, hood, fenders, and A-pillars.

advert.headline: 248-Mile 1999 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR4 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1999 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4 remained under the care of a previous owner for two decades until 2022, and it now shows 248 miles. Finished in Solano Black Pearl over black leather upholstery, the car is powered by a twin-turbocharged and intercooled 3.0-liter V6 linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and an all-wheel drive system. Equipment includes fog lights, front and rear spoilers, a rear wing, four-wheel steering, 18″ aluminum alloy wheels, power windows, cruise control, an Infinity sound system, a CD/cassette stereo, and automatic climate control. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this 3000GT VR-4 is offered in Illinois with service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.
The car is finished in Solano Black Pearl (X08) and features front and rear spoilers, integrated fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, front and rear side vents, and a quadruple-outlet exhaust system. Paint protection film is noted to have been applied to the body in 2022.

advert.headline: 2014 Ferrari FF
advert.description:
This 2014 Ferrari FF was ordered new with over $22k in optional equipment including 20″ Sport Forged Diamond wheels, red-finished brake calipers, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields for the Nero Daytona-finished bodywork, a carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel with LED shift lights, a dual-view front parking camera, Cavallino Rampante-embroidered headrests, and contrast stitching and Alcantara interior accents for the Nero leather-trimmed cabin. Work in July 2022 at a cost of over $16k included overhauling the seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle, and further details include a 6.3-liter F140 V12, a front-mounted two-speed transaxle, an all-wheel-drive system, parking sensors, heated front seats, and an aftermarket radar detector. This FF has 43k miles and is now offered in California by the selling dealer with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a battery tender, a clean Carfax report, and a Michigan title.
The Pininfarina-styled “shooting brake” grand tourer body is finished in Nero Daytona and features bi-xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, parking sensors, a rear diffuser, and quad exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 2024 Ariel Atom 4
advert.description:
This 2024 Ariel Atom 4 wears white and black Marlboro #44 decals on its Ariel Red bodywork, and it was assembled with the Performance Package, which provided a performance exhaust system and a limited-slip differential in addition to a variable boost controller, a high-performance radiator, and a 350-horsepower ECU tune for the turbocharged 2.0-liter Honda K20C i-VTEC inline-four. Equipment includes a six-speed manual transaxle, 16″ front and 17″ rear multi-spoke cast alloy wheels, JRi double-adjustable dampers, AP Racing brake calipers, front and rear wings, a microsuede-wrapped steering wheel, six-point racing harnesses, and a roll hoop. This Atom 4 has 455 miles and is now offered in Texas with its order invoice and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.
The car was built in Halifax County, Virginia, by TMI AutoTech, under license from Ariel Motor Company of the UK and features a MIG-welded tubular steel chassis with a roll structure that includes forward, rearward, and cross bracing. The bodywork is finished in Ariel Red with white and black Marlboro decals, and exterior details include front and rear wings, a windshield, free-standing triple-pod LED indicators, daytime running lamps, automatic headlights, taillights, and a sealed intake snorkel.

advert.headline: 40k-Mile 2004 Porsche 911 GT3
advert.description:
This 2004 Porsche 911 GT3 has 40k miles and was specified in Atlas Grey Metallic over black leather upholstery. Powered by a 3.6-liter Mezger flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, the car features staggered-width 18″ GT3 wheels, ceramic composite brakes, a body-color center console, power-adjustable sport seats, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. Work completed in 2023 included replacing the spark plugs, ignition coils, drive belt, and engine mounts. This 996.2 GT3 is offered at no reserve with a Porsche Production Specifications sheet, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.
The car is finished in Atlas Grey Metallic (M7X) and features a fixed rear wing and revised aerodynamic lower bodywork. Additional exterior features include power-adjustable mirrors and dual exhaust outlets. There is a crack in the aftermarket front lip, and paint protection film has been applied to the front fenders, front bumper cover, mirrors, and ahead of the rear wheels. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 1997 Acura NSX-T 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 1997 Acura NSX-T shows 93k miles through the current owner’s purchase in 2023, and it is said to be one of 15 cars for the model year finished in Monte Carlo Blue Pearl over Onyx leather and equipped with a six-speed manual transaxle. Powered by a 3.2-liter DOHC V6, the car is equipped with staggered-diameter 16” and 17” aluminum wheels, a limited-slip differential, a removable body-color roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. This NSX-T is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner at no reserve with a window sticker, service records, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the current owner’s name.
The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Monte Carlo Blue Pearl with a body-color removable roof panel. Exterior details include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint chips and scratches are noted on the body.

advert.headline: Restored 1968 Jaguar XKE Series 1.5 4.2 Coupe
advert.description:
This 1968 Jaguar XKE Series 1.5 coupe remained registered with a single family in California until 2024. The car was subsequently disassembled and restored by E-Type specialists Images Auto Body of Campbell, California, under the direction of Dave Ferguson and at a cost of ~$133k. Work involved repainting the British Racing Green exterior, reupholstering the black leather interior, overhauling the brakes and suspension, mounting Pirelli tires on the 15″ wire-spoke wheels, rebuilding the 4.2-liter inline-six, and resealing the four-speed manual transmission and differential. Around 1k miles have been added since the work was completed in 2025. This XKE Series 1.5 coupe is now offered with a Jaguar Heritage Trust Certificate, historical registrations, two black California plates, removed and spare components, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The Series 1.5 E-Types featured exposed headlights shared with Series II cars but retained Series I equipment such as a small front grille opening, turn signals mounted above the front bumper, and taillights situated above the split rear bumper. This example was originally specified in British Racing Green, and Images Auto Body of Campbell, California disassembled, stripped and repainted the body.

advert.headline: 2015 Porsche 911 GT3
advert.description:
This 2015 Porsche 911 GT3 has been registered in Florida and Nevada since new, and it was specified in Agate Gray Metallic over a Black leather and Alcantara interior with red stitching. The car was also ordered with an extended range 23.9-gallon fuel tank, a front-axle lift system, Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, LED headlights with PDLS+, clear LED taillights, the Sound Package Plus, Guards Red instrument dials and seatbelts, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. Indicating 33k miles, further appointments include a 3.8-liter flat-six, a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle, 20″ and 21″ center-lock alloy wheels, and a muffler bypass pipe. Purchased in 2021 by the seller, this 991.1 GT3 is now offered with a build sheet, service records, removed parts, and a Nevada title.
The 991 GT3 featured revised front and rear bumper covers when compared to the standard Carrera as well as a rear wing and dual center-exit exhaust pipes. This example is finished in Agate Gray Metallic, and additional equipment includes LED headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System Plus (PDLS+), body-color covers for the headlight washers, and clear LED taillights. The Carfax report shows damage to the rear and left-rear in June 2015, and the seller notes a bulge on the left quarter panel as a result. There is a scratch on the right window and one scratch near the right window.

advert.headline: 1958 Porsche 356A Emory Outlaw Cabriolet Race Car
advert.description:
This 1958 Porsche 356A is a Reutter-built cabriolet that was acquired by a prior owner as a rolling project in the early 2000s and sent to Emory Motorsports, where it was modified by the late Gary Emory for vintage racing with a 1,620cc flat-four and a Type 741/2 four-speed manual transaxle as well as a central fuel filler, a louvered engine lid, a roll bar, and four-wheel disc brakes. The car was then driven in CSRG and SOVREN events throughout the Pacific Northwest before being featured on BaT in September 2007 . Following a partial repaint, Chassis 150601 appeared on the site again in March 2009 , and it spent several years with a collector in Germany until the current owner’s acquisition in 2017. The engine is equipped with dual Solex carburetors and an Ahnendorp exhaust system, and other highlights include a removable hardtop, driving lights, a Sebring-style side mirror, space-saver wheels, houndstooth upholstery, an Abarth steering wheel, and a fire suppression system. This 356A Outlaw is now offered by the selling dealer, a BaT local partner, on consignment as part of Mohr Imports’ Pacific Porsche Collection with a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, a SOVREN logbook, service records, and a clean Montana title in the name of the owner’s LLC.
Work performed during the initial build at Emory Motorsports is said to have taken place at the direction of Gary Emory and involved modifying the hood to accommodate a central fuel filler and adding inverted louvers to the engine lid. The body was repainted in red with white roundels, and a roll bar was installed. The removable hardtop and portions of the upper bodywork were refinished in black with orange pinstriping around 2008, and Pegasus graphics were added to the fenders. Paint chips and flaws around the car can be viewed in the image gallery below.

advert.model: Dodge Challenger SRT Demon & Super Stock
advert.headline: 303-Mile 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Demon 170
advert.description:
This 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Demon 170 is #343 of approximately 3,300 examples built for the model year and has 303 miles. Power is provided by a supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi High-Output V8 producing up to 1,025 horsepower and 945 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels via an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car is finished in Go Mango over black leather and Alcantara and features the Premium Group equipment package, an Air-Grabber hood, a front splitter, a rear spoiler, Air-Catcher headlights, flared quarter panels, Brembo brake calipers, and 17” and 18″ forged wheels along with heated and ventilated seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation. This SRT Demon 170 was acquired by the current owner in 2023 and is now offered on dealer consignment in Florida with a Demon decanter set, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Indiana title.
Dodge released seven different Last Call special editions for the 2023 model year to celebrate the end of production of the Charger and Challenger, and the Demon 170 was the final special edition variant. This example is finished in Go Mango (PVP) and features an Air-Grabber hood with a satin black graphic and “Alcohol Injected” lettering on the hood-scoop bezel. Other exterior details include a front splitter that has retained its yellow scuff guards, Air-Catcher HID headlights, flared rear quarter panels, dual exhaust outlets, and an SRT Performance rear spoiler with an integrated rearview camera. XPEL paint protection film, XPEL ceramic window tint, and a ceramic coating were applied in December 2023.

advert.headline: 1991 Porsche 911 Carrera 2 Coupe 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1991 Porsche 911 Carrera 2 was registered in California until 2012, and it was sold on BaT in February 2019 by the selling dealer before it was registered in Illinois. The car was optioned with a limited-slip differential, sport seats, an electric sunroof, and cruise control, and it has been modified with KW V3 coilovers, 17″ Cup-style Mille Miglia wheels, front brake cooling ducts, a B&B exhaust system, a revised engine management chip, and a Clarion Bluetooth stereo head unit. Finished in Grand Prix White over black leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.6L flat-six paired with a 5-speed manual transaxle. Reacquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this 964 shows 111k miles, and it is offered in California with a 2025 pre-purchase inspection document, partial service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax, and an Illinois title.
The body was repainted in the factory shade of Grand Prix White under previous ownership. Exterior revisions include Rennline door handles, aero mirrors, and brake cooling ducts in the front bumper. There are touched-up stone chips on the leading portion of the frunk lid, and there is a scratch on the corner of the rear bumper.

advert.headline: 2020 Alfa Romeo 4C Spider 33 Stradale Tributo
advert.description:
This 2020 Alfa Romeo 4C Spider 33 Stradale Tributo is #8 of the 33 vehicles produced for the North American market to honor the 1967 Alfa Romeo 33 Stradale and to commemorate the end of 4C production. Now indicating 10k miles, the car was purchased new by the seller and was previously listed on BaT in November 2025 . Power comes from a turbocharged 1.7-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle, and edition-specific equipment included Rosso Villa d’Este Tri-Coat paint, gold-finished 18″ and 19″ five-hole alloy wheels, a serialized dash plaque, an Akrapovič dual-mode exhaust system, a race-tuned suspension, and a red-finished carbon-fiber monocoque. Black and Tobacco upholstery trims the interior, and additional equipment includes rear parking sensors, cruise control, bi-xenon headlights, manually adjustable sport seats, an Alpine stereo, and air conditioning. This 4C is offered in California with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Maine title in the seller’s name.
The carbon-fiber monocoque chassis was designed at Centro Stile Alfa Romeo and is wrapped in composite bodywork with commemorative badging. The exterior is finished in Rosso Villa D’Este Tri-Coat with a carbon-fiber roll hoop, a piano black rear diffuser, piano black and carbon-fiber front fascia vents, and a carbon-fiber side air intake. Additional details include a removable fabric soft top, bi-xenon headlights, LED taillights, and rear parking sensors.

advert.headline: 1963 Porsche 356B Cabriolet
advert.description:
This 1963 Porsche 356B cabriolet was acquired by the current owner in 2023 and subsequently underwent a refurbishment, including replacement floors, a reupholstered interior, and an overhaul of the engine. The car has been refinished in Oslo Blue over red leather, and is powered by a 1.6-liter flat-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes a black soft top, 15″ steel wheels with hubcaps, vent windows, body-color bumpers, and front bucket seats. This 356B cabriolet is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a copy of the Kardex, service records, refurbishment photos, and an Arizona title in the name of the current owner’s family trust.
This Reutter-built body came finished from the factory in Oslo Blue (6203) and was repainted in 2021. The brightwork was re-chromed at that time and a replacement black soft top was installed.

advert.headline: 427 ZL1-Powered 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Coupe 4-Speed
advert.description:
This 1969 Chevrolet Camaro coupe was refurbished and modified in the style of a ZL-1 model before being purchased by the seller in 2012, sold in 2022, and purchased by the seller again in 2025. The 427ci V8 utilizes a late-1990s ZL1 aluminum block with casting number 3946053, was most recently rebuilt in 2019, and is linked to a Muncie M22 “rock crusher” four-speed manual transmission and a 12-bolt rear end with a 3.55:1 limited-slip differential. The body is finished in black and features a black vinyl roof cover, a cowl induction hood, ZL-1 badging, and front and rear spoilers, while the interior is trimmed in black with front bucket seats, a center console with Rally gauges, an AM radio, and a 140-mph speedometer. The engine features an aluminum intake manifold with Winters Foundry markings as well as Chevrolet Performance aluminum cylinder heads, a Holley 850-cfm four-barrel carburetor, and Hooker headers that feed into a 3.5″ dual exhaust system. The chassis is equipped with Hotchkiss subframe connectors, CalTracs adjustable rear traction bars, power-assisted front disc brakes, and 18″ Forgeline wheels. This modified Camaro is now offered with a set of four Cragar S/S wheels, a dyno sheet, 2012-2025 invoices, a seller-provided summary, car show awards, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.
The body was stripped, repaired, and refinished in black with a black vinyl roof cover during the refurbishment completed in 2011. The seller notes the ZL-1 badges are reproduced pieces in the style of Chevrolet prototype Camaros of the period, and additional details include a cowl induction hood, RS-style hideaway headlights, front and rear spoilers, and rocker and wheel-arch moldings.

advert.headline: 2015 Audi R8 V10 Coupe
advert.description:
This 2015 Audi R8 coupe was purchased new by the seller and now has 30k miles following history in California. It is finished in Daytona Gray Pearl over Black leather with Dark Silver stitching and is powered by a 5.2-liter FSI V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed S-tronic transaxle. Equipment includes the Full Fine Nappa Leather and Audi Exclusive Black Optic Packages as well as Carbon Sigma side blades and interior trim, a Sport exhaust, Titanium-finished 19″ Y-design wheels, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and a Bang and Olufsen sound system. This R8 was previously listed on BaT in May 2025 and is offered again with a window sticker, service records, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Daytona Gray Pearl with Carbon Sigma side blades and features LED headlights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, integrated dual exhaust outlets, and front and rear parking sensors. Damage is indicated on the Carfax report in subsequent September 2017 and December 2019 entries, affecting the front and right rear of the vehicle, respectively. In 2017, metal debris hit the right headlight while driving, and the headlight and housing were replaced in October 2017. The seller adds that the 2019 incident occurred at low speeds when the car’s right-rear quarter panel was hit by another vehicle exiting a restaurant driveway, after which the panel was replaced in 2020. The associated invoices are provided in the gallery below.

advert.headline: Fuel-Injected 1963 Chevrolet Corvette Split-Window Coupe 4-Speed
advert.description:
This 1963 Chevrolet Corvette split-window coupe was acquired by the previous owner on BaT in May 2025 and is powered by a fuel-injected replacement 327ci V8 paired with a four-speed manual transmission. The car is refinished in red over black vinyl upholstery, and further equipped with 15″ steel wheels with three-eared knock-off spinner-style hubcaps, a push-button AM radio, a stainless steel exhaust system, and concealed headlights. This C2 split-window coupe was acquired by the selling dealer in late 2025 and is now offered at no reserve as part of the F_Tundra collection in Costa Mesa, California, with a clean Illinois title.
The fiberglass body was factory finished in Riverside Red (923), and a repaint is said to have been completed in the mid 1980s. Features include flip-up headlamps, fender vents, quad tail lamps, chrome bumperettes, and dual exhaust tips that exit through the rear valance.

advert.headline: Carbon-Fiber-Bodied, ’69 Charger–Style 2021 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat
advert.description:
This 2021 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat is said to have been modified by Six Twelve Auto Worx of Nanuet, New York, with a 1969 Dodge Charger–style exposed carbon–fiber body. Power comes from a supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. The cabin is trimmed in Demonic Red Laguna leather upholstery and the car features HID Air Catcher headlamps, staggered 20″ SRT-style wheels, Brembo brake calipers, Bilstein adaptive dampers, a heated steering wheel, heated and ventilated front seats, blind-spot monitoring, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon audio system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this modified Hellcat has 2,800 miles and is now offered with the manufacturer’s literature and an Oregon title.
This Challenger SRT Hellcat chassis was reportedly modified by Six Twelve Auto Worx with molded-carbon-fiber bodywork inspired by the 1969 Dodge Charger. The car is finished in Demon Smoke clearcoat with a red rear stripe and other highlights include a cowl hood, HID Air Catcher headlamps, LED taillights, a carbon-fiber taillight surround, a flip-up fuel cap, a rear diffuser, scalloped doors, fitted body-color bumpers, and center-exit dual-exhaust finishers.

advert.headline: 2023 Jayco Melbourne Prestige 24RP
advert.description:
This 2023 Jayco Melbourne Prestige was built by Jayco, Inc. of Middlebury, Indiana, using a 2022 Mercedes-Benz 3500XD chassis, and it is powered by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Optioned with the Customer Value package, the van is finished in multi-hue gray, beige, and maroon and is equipped with 16″ alloy wheels, a dually rear axle, a power-sliding side wall, rear- and side-view cameras, a hitch receiver, hydraulic leveling jacks, an awning, a solar panel, heated front captain’s chairs, keyless entry, Distronic cruise control, automatic climate control, and MBUX infotainment with navigation. It also has a kitchenette, a bathroom, a dinette area, a television, a Murphy bed, a diesel generator, a tankless water heater, and heated freshwater tanks. Following registration history in Washington, Arizona, and South Dakota, the van was purchased by the seller in 2025 and relocated to Oregon. This Melbourne Prestige has 15k miles and is offered with a window sticker, owner’s manuals, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title in the seller’s name.
The van is finished in the Sycamore colorway of gray and beige with maroon accents, and it features a pop-out left-side wall along with a seamless fiberglass front cap. Exterior details include rear- and side-view cameras, fog lights, side steps, a hitch receiver, a powered armless awning, an outdoor shower, a solar roof panel, a ceiling vent, a roof-mounted climate-control system, tinted windows, and hydraulic leveling jacks.

advert.headline: 2023 Winnebago Navion 24D
advert.description:
This 2023 Winnebago Navion 24D is a Class C motorhome built on a 2023 Mercedes-Benz Sprinter chassis, and it has 2,400 miles. Power is provided by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Finished in Silver Grey, the exterior is equipped with a left-side power slide-out, a receiver hitch, a ladder, and a camp-side awning. Interior features include a kitchenette, a bathroom, an over-cab sleeping platform, and an aftermarket sound system with a touchscreen stereo, Focal speakers, an AudioControl amplifier, and a JL Audio subwoofer. This Winnebago Navion is offered by the selling dealer with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.
The body is finished in Silver Grey (7708) and features a raised roof height, Parktronic sensors, a camp-side awning, a Cummins generator, a ladder, a left-side power slide-out, and tinted windows. Service performed in July 2023 included the application of clear paint protection film (PPF) to the front end, a ceramic coating, and window tinting.

advert.headline: 427-Powered 1968 Ford Mustang GT500CR 5-Speed by Classic Recreations
advert.description:
This 1968 Ford Mustang was built by Classic Recreations in 2021 as one of the company’s GT500CR models in the style of the 1967 Shelby GT500 Super Snake continuation model. Highlighting the build is a Ford Performance 427ci V8 that is equipped with Holley fuel injection, and it is linked to a Tremec TKO 600 five-speed manual transmission and a FAB9 rear end with a 3.50 limited-slip differential. The car rides on 18″ American Racing wheels and has Mustang II-style front end, a four-link rear, six-piston Wilwood brakes, coilovers, and subframe connectors, and other details include an Edelbrock intake manifold, MSD ignition, BBK Performance headers, and MagnaFlow mufflers. The car is equipped with sequential taillights, grille-mounted fog lights, and blue stripes accenting its white finish, and the cabin is outfitted with a wood-rimmed steering wheel, Shelby-branded instrumentation, SCAT seats, a roll bar, and a Kenwood head unit linked to a Focal amplifier and speakers. Acquired by the current owner in 2019, this GT500CR is now offered on dealer consignment with a seller-provided build list and a California title listing the car as a 1968 Ford.
Finished in white with blue stripes, the bodywork features fiberglass components, grille-mounted fog lights, mini-tubbed rear wheel wells, sequential taillights, GT500CR badging, and red lights behind the quarter panel scoops.

advert.headline: 24k-Mile 2010 Ferrari California
advert.description:
This 2010 Ferrari California has 24k miles, and work in November 2025 performed by Ferrari of Beverly Hills, California, at a cost of over $3k included an annual service for the 4.3-liter V8. Finished in Blu Tour de France over Cuoio leather, appointments include a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle, a limited-slip differential, a retractable hardtop, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, parking sensors, aftermarket 21″ and 22″ multi-spoke wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes with yellow-finished calipers, a carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel, and power-adjustable Daytona-style front seats. Purchased in 2024 by the seller, this California is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, the removed set of wheels, a battery tender, a clean Carfax report, and a California title.
The Pininfarina-designed bodywork is finished in Blu Tour de France with Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, and additional exterior appointments include a two-piece folding retractable hardtop, fender vents, a hood scoop, a front lip spoiler, xenon headlights, an integrated rear spoiler, parking sensors, and stacked quad exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 14k-Mile 2016 Porsche 911 Carrera 4 GTS Coupe
advert.description:
This 2016 Porsche 911 Carrera 4 GTS is a Sapphire Blue Metallic-finished coupe that has 14k miles through the current owner’s purchase in 2016, and it was optioned from the factory with the SportDesign Package. Powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle, the car is further equipped with black leather and Alcantara upholstery, the Sport Chrono Package, a limited-slip differential, Porsche Torque Vectoring, center-locking 20″ Turbo S alloy wheels, Power Steering Plus, LED headlights with PDLS+, ParkAssist parking sensors, a glass sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, and a Bose sound system. This 991.1 C4 GTS coupe is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner in Florida with the owner’s manual, a center-lock wheel lock nut socket, a torque wrench, a battery tender, an accident-free Carfax report, and an Alabama title in the owner’s name.
The GTS features wider bodywork than the standard Carrera as well as a front lower lip spoiler, side skirts, SportDesign side mirrors, and a revised front apron. This example is finished in Sapphire Blue Metallic and was optioned with SportDesign body components. Additional details include LED headlights with PDLS+, auto-dimming mirrors, a glass sunroof, ParkAssist parking sensors, LED taillights, a light strip between the taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. Imperfections are highlighted in the gallery.

advert.headline: 2.7L-Powered 1968 Porsche 912 Coupe 5-Speed
advert.description:
This 1968 Porsche 912 coupe is powered by a 2,650cc flat-four mated to a five-speed manual transaxle, and it is finished in Slate Gray over black leatherette. Features include electronic ignition, a 911-style fan shroud, dual Weber carburetors, dual oil coolers, a merged header, a Dynomax muffler, a front strut tower brace, Weltmeister sway bars, Bilstein dampers, disc brakes, 15″ Fuchs forged alloy wheels, and headlight grilles. Inside, it is equipped with a roll bar, a MOMO steering wheel, fixed-back bucket seats, RS-style door panels, an aftermarket shifter, aluminum pedal covers, and Coco floor mats. Previously sold on BaT in January 2025 , this 912 coupe is now offered through a BaT Local Partner on dealer consignment with a binder of records, an owner’s manual, and a clean California title.
The car left the factory finished in Slate Gray (6801) and repairs were carried out on the floor, left door, left quarter panel, fenders, and bumpers before the body was repainted in 2014. Equipment includes yellow-tinted fog lights, H4 headlights, mesh headlight grilles, a driver-side mirror, quarter vent windows, 912S badging, and a single exhaust outlet.

advert.headline: ERA 289 Slabside Cobra Replica 4-Speed
advert.description:
This ERA is said to be the first 289 Slabside Cobra replica produced by the manufacturer, and it was assembled in the 2000s by Cobra Restorers in Kennesaw, Georgia. Finished in black over black leather, the car is powered by a 289ci Ford V8 linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes an aluminum radiator, tubular headers, a four-wheel independent suspension, disc brakes, 15″ wire-spoke wheels, chrome bumpers, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, Stewart-Warner instrumentation, low-back bucket seats, and racing harnesses. The car was previously sold on BaT in April 2018 and was purchased by the seller in October 2020 before it was sold to the current owner in April 2021. This Cobra replica shows 1,900 miles and is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Arizona title that lists the car as a 1965 Ford Shelby.
The fiberglass bodywork is finished in black. Exterior details include front fender vents, a bullet-style driver mirror, wind wings, a LeMans-style fuel filler cap, chrome bumper hoops and overriders, and dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers. Clear paint protection film was applied to the painted surfaces under current ownership.

advert.headline: 1990 Ferrari 348 TS
advert.description:
This 1990 Ferrari 348 TS is finished in Blu Medio over beige upholstery and is powered by a 3.4-liter DOHC V8 linked to a five-speed manual transaxle with a dogleg-pattern gated shifter. Features include a Nouvalari exhaust system, a limited-slip differential, a removable roof panel, pop-up headlights, and 17″ five-spoke wheels along with an aftermarket sound system, an alarm system, air conditioning, and drilled metal pedals. The car was acquired by the selling dealer on BaT in June 2023 , and subsequent work included retrimming the interior, repairing the front bumper cover, and replacing the ECU, steering rack bushings, and tires. This 348 shows 50k miles and is now offered at no reserve in Florida with an owner’s manual, supplementary literature, a tool kit, a car cover, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.
The 348 was the final V8-powered Ferrari model developed under the direction of Enzo Ferrari, and its design was overseen by Pininfarina chief stylist Leonardo Fioravanti. This example is finished in Blu Medio with black lower-body panels and has a removable black roof panel, pop-up headlights, fog lights, side air intakes, louvered taillights, and quad exhaust tips. An F355-style hood vent has been installed in place of the factory unit. Imperfections on the left door were repaired and refinished in 2015. The front bumper cover was repaired in 2024, according to the seller, who notes that recent work included performing a paint correction and applying a ceramic coating. Chips, dents, and areas of touch-up paint are present around the exterior.

advert.headline: 3,400-Mile 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 Coupe 3ZR
advert.description:
This 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 coupe has 3,400 miles and has been registered in California following its initial delivery to Camino Real Chevrolet in Monterey Park. Finished in Blade Silver Metallic over gray leather, it was optioned with the 3ZR Premium Equipment group, whose highlights include the Sueded Microfiber-Wrapped Upper Trim package, heated and ventilated power-adjustable GT bucket seats, a performance data and video recorder, front curb-view cameras, a Bose sound system, and carbon-fiber trim. Powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter LT5 V8 linked with an eight-speed automatic gearbox and an electronic limited-slip differential, it is further equipped with ZR1 Chrome Aluminum wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, Magnetic Ride Control, a removable carbon-fiber roof panel, xenon headlights, a rear wing, a back-up camera, a head-up display, and a touchscreen infotainment system. Acquired by the seller in 2025, this C7 ZR1 is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, spare parts, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The ZR1 features a clear-coated carbon-fiber front splitter and rocker-panel extensions along with a vented carbon-fiber hood and exposed carbon fiber on the cooling vent surrounds and engine cover. This example is finished in Blade Silver Metallic and features a rear wing as well as a removable carbon-fiber roof panel, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable mirrors, and a multi-mode exhaust system with quadruple outlets. The seller notes the car was ceramic coated under previous ownership.

advert.headline: 3,800-Mile 2017 Bentley Continental GT V8 S
advert.description:
This 2017 Bentley Continental GT V8 S remained registered to its original owner in Texas until 2025, and it now has 3,800 miles. It is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transaxle and is finished in Hallmark over Beluga leather upholstery. The car is equipped with bi-xenon headlights, Park Distance Control parking sensors, adjustable air suspension, 21″ Propeller ten-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats with massaging elements, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an infotainment system with a CD changer and navigation. This Continental GT V8 S was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a Texas title.
The car is finished in Hallmark, and features include bi-xenon headlights, front and rear parking sensors, mesh front grilles, bright trim, a rear spoiler, and twin figure-eight exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 1,400-Mile 2020 Mercedes-Benz S560 Cabriolet
advert.description:
This 2020 Mercedes-Benz S560 cabriolet remained with the original owner until the selling dealer’s acquisition and has 1,400 miles. The car is finished in Lunar Blue Metallic over Crystal Gray and black Designo Exclusive Nappa leather, and it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 that drives the rear wheels through a nine-speed automatic transmission. It is equipped with a blue convertible soft top, dynamic LED headlights, OLED taillights, 20″ AMG satin multi-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, an Aircap anti-turbulence front windshield airfoil, and an Airscarf neck and shoulder warming system. This A217 S560 cabriolet is offered by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.
The car is finished in Lunar Blue Metallic, and exterior features include a blue convertible soft top, an Aircap anti-turbulence front windshield airfoil, dynamic LED headlights, OLED taillights, pillarless side windows, front and rear parking sensors, soft-close doors, and quad exhaust outlets. Photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery.

advert.headline: Coyote-Powered 1977 Lincoln Continental Town Car
advert.description:
This 1977 Lincoln Continental Town Car was purchased by the seller in 2023 and sent to Carlson Hot Rods in Mulvane, Kansas, where it underwent more than $114k in work over the next two years. The drivetrain was converted to a 5.0-liter Gen 2 Coyote V8 linked to a six-speed automatic transmission, and additional refurbishment involved repainting the body, replacing the vinyl roof, lowering the suspension, and overhauling the power steering and brakes. Factory options include opera windows, dual remote-control side mirrors, and power-adjustable front seats, and the interior offers black cloth upholstery, a Vintage Air climate control system, and a push-button AM/FM radio. This custom Continental is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with build records, an Ownercard, manufacturer’s literature, and a clean Pennsylvania title.
The car left the factory finished in black with a matching vinyl roof. The selling dealer relays that work performed by Carlson Hot Rods totaled over $114k, and involved stripping the exterior and repairing rust on the right-rear door and above the front and rear indicators, after which it was repainted in Ford Tuxedo Metallic Black. The exterior brightwork was triple chrome-plated, and the vinyl roof was replaced.

advert.headline: Modified 1986 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe
advert.description:
This 1986 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe was acquired new by the late owner and was modified in the 1990s for track use. It has been fitted with an RS-style rear wing as well as an aftermarket front spoiler, and it rides on polished 18″ Speedline three-piece wheels. Finished in black over Cashmere Beige leather, the car is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six equipped with a K29 turbocharger, an Andial Racing intercooler, tubular headers, and a muffler delete pipe. Inside, the cabin houses sport seats with multi-point harnesses, a roll cage, a MOMO steering wheel, and an Alpine CD stereo. Additional equipment includes a four-speed manual transaxle, a limited-slip differential, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a power sunroof, and air conditioning. Work in preparation for the sale is said to have involved rebuilding the turbocharger and fuel distributor as well as replacing the torsion bars, fuel injectors, CDI box, fuel accumulator, and fuel pressure regulator. This 930 Turbo coupe is now offered on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a Florida title.
The car is finished in black with an electric sunroof and has been fitted with an RS-style rear wing with a carbon-fiber insert as well as an aftermarket front spoiler, power-adjustable mirrors, and H4 headlights.

advert.headline: 14k-Mile 2013 Bentley Continental GTC W12
advert.description:
This 2013 Bentley Continental GTC W12 has 14k miles following registration history in Texas, and it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 6.0-liter W12 that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transaxle. Finished in white over beige leather, the car is equipped with bi-xenon headlights, a convertible top, Park Distance Control parking sensors, adjustable air suspension, 21″ Propeller ten-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats with neck warmers and massaging elements, dual-zone automatic climate control, wood interior trim, and an infotainment system with a CD changer and navigation. This Continental GTC W12 was acquired by the selling dealer in 2026 and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a Texas title.
The car is finished in white and has a power-operated soft top, bi-xenon headlights, mesh front grilles, front and rear parking sensors, bright trim, and twin oval exhaust outlets. According to the Carfax report, the convertible top was repaired in June 2024.

advert.headline: 22k-Mile 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe was registered with two owners in Kansas and Indiana before it was acquired by the seller on BaT in July 2021 , and it now has 22k miles. Modifications under current ownership included the installation of Öhlins coilovers, FVD Brombacher mufflers, a Numeric Racing short shifter, a MOMO steering wheel, a Bluetooth Alpine head unit, and clear front corner markers. Finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over black leather, the car is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono Plus and Bose High End Sound packages as well as 19″ wheels, bi-xenon headlights, heated and power-adjustable front seats, and automatic climate control. This 997 Carrera S is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, removed stock parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (92U) and features bi-xenon headlights with washers, a sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and quad stainless steel exhaust outlets. Clear front corner markers were installed under current ownership along with replacement stone guards in front of the rear wheels. Scrapes are visible on the underside of the front bumper cover, a scratch is present near the left headlight washer, there is a scuff on the right mirror cap, and close-up photos of paint meter readings and imperfections are shown in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 2020 Lotus Evora GT 2+2 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2020 Lotus Evora GT is a 2+2 example that was specified with a six-speed manual transaxle, black-finished 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke alloy wheels, and heated carbon-fiber front bucket seats. The car has 31k miles following registration history in Florida and Idaho, and it was purchased by its current owner in May 2024. It is finished in Monaco White over black leather with red Alcantara accents, and power is from a supercharged 3.5-liter V6. Additional features include a limited-slip differential, AP Racing brake calipers, bi-xenon headlights, LED taillights, parking sensors, two rear seats, a rear-view camera, an Alpine head unit, cruise control, and air conditioning. This Evora GT is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with the owner’s manual, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Idaho title.
The composite body is finished in Monaco White, and exterior equipment includes bi-xenon headlights, LED taillights, an integrated rear spoiler, parking sensors, and a single exhaust outlet that exits through the center of the rear diffuser. The rear hatch struts were replaced and clear paint-protection film was applied to the nose in April 2025.

advert.headline: 2012 Porsche 911 Carrera S Cabriolet 6-Speed
advert.description:
This 2012 Porsche 911 Carrera S cabriolet is finished in Guards Red over black leather and is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six linked to a six-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono, Infotainment, and Comfort packages as well as 19” Turbo wheels, bi-xenon headlights, a power-operated black soft top, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, navigation, a CD stereo, and Porsche Communication Management linked to a Bose sound system. The car was previously sold on BaT in April 2024 and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025. This Carrera S cabriolet has 51k miles and is offered by the selling dealer in Oregon with a wind deflector, a clean Carfax report, and a California title.
The body is finished in Guards Red and features a power-operated black soft top. Exterior details include fog lights, bi-xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a speed-activated rear spoiler, LED taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. Scuffs are visible on the bottom of the front bumper cover.

advert.headline: 6.0L Vortec-Powered 1967 Chevrolet Camaro Coupe
advert.description:
This 1967 Chevrolet Camaro coupe was purchased by the owner in 1982, and refurbishment and modifications performed over a ten-year period ending in 2025 involved repainting the body in metallic red as well as installing a 6.0-liter LQ9 Vortec V8, a 4L80E four-speed automatic transmission, and a Ford 9″ rear end with a 3.73:1 limited-slip differential. The car rides on Detroit Speed tubular front control arms, a Detroit Speed triangulated rear four-link setup, adjustable coilovers, and rack-and-pinion steering as well as Wilwood disc brakes and 18″ American Racing wheels. Inside, the front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in black vinyl and accompanied by a center console, aftermarket air conditioning, a digital stereo unit, and Dakota Digital gauges. Additional equipment includes an aluminum radiator, FiTech electronic fuel injection, a fabricated sheet metal intake manifold, and a dual exhaust system with coated headers and Flowmaster FlowFX mufflers. This modified Camaro is now offered on dealer consignment with a clean Idaho title.
The body was refinished in metallic red with a black nose stripe during the refurbishment. Details include RS-style hideaway headlights, an SS-style hood with raised simulated air intakes, front and rear spoilers, a driver-side mirror, and chrome bumpers. Blemishes in the finish are pictured in the gallery below.

advert.headline: 3,600-Mile 2018 BMW Alpina B7 xDrive
advert.description:
This 2018 BMW Alpina B7 xDrive was purchased new by the current owner, who has registered it in Texas, and it has 3,600 miles. The car was ordered with the optional Rear Executive Lounge Seating and Parking Assistance packages, while the Cold Weather and Executive packages were standard, and all of them together provided heated and ventilated front and rear seats, power-adjustable reclining rear seats, a right-rear footrest, an Executive Lounge rear center console with a 7″ Touch Command Tablet, a rear-seat entertainment system, a surround-view camera system, and a head-up display. Additional appointments include a twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V8, an eight-speed automatic transmission, an xDrive all-wheel-drive system, matte-finished paint-protection film for the Alpina Green Metallic-finished bodywork, a panoramic Sky Lounge LED sunroof, 21″ Alpina Style CS16 alloy wheels, Executive Drive Pro suspension, a Bowers & Wilkins surround sound system, and Smoke White and Black Merino leather upholstery. This G12 Alpina B7 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a Texas title in the owner’s name.
The car is finished in Alpina Green Metallic (X09) with Shadowline trim, and matte-finished paint-protection film was applied in 2018. Exterior details include adaptive LED headlights, LED fog lights, a panoramic Sky Lounge LED sunroof, a rear spoiler, Park Distance Control parking sensors, soft-close automatic doors, and heated power-folding side mirrors.

advert.headline: 2021 Porsche Cayenne GTS
advert.description:
This 2021 Porsche Cayenne GTS was specified with over $38k in optional features including Carmine Red paintwork, Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, 21″ RS Spyder Design wheels, the Sport Chrono Package, and black leather and Race-Tex upholstery with Carmine Red accents. It also has a panoramic sunroof, black Porsche graphics, gloss-black exterior accents, soft-close doors, a Bose sound system, a heated steering wheel and front seats, and driver aids including a head-up display, Night Vision Assist, Lane Change Assist, and Lane Keeping Assist. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission, and additional equipment includes Adaptive Air Suspension, Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), a sport exhaust system, and aftermarket suspension lowering links. The vehicle was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and has 54k miles. This 9Y0 Cayenne is now offered in Illinois with a digital copy of the window sticker, two key fobs, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.
The 9Y0 Cayenne debuted for the 2019 model year based on the MLB Evo architecture shared with the Lamborghini Urus, Bentley Bentayga, and Audi Q8. This example is finished in Carmine Red (M3C) and features SportDesign exterior styling, black Porsche graphics, and gloss-black roof rails, door handles, and auto-dimming side mirrors. It also has a panoramic sunroof, LED headlights, thermally and noise-insulated glass, a receiver hitch, and soft-close doors with Porsche logo puddle lights. The Carfax report notes that the windshield was replaced in 2024.

advert.model: Dodge Challenger SRT Demon & Super Stock
advert.headline: 1,900-Mile 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Super Stock
advert.description:
This 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Super Stock is finished in Pitch Black over Demonic Red Laguna leather and is powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Performance features include launch control with Launch Assist, a Super Stock adaptive-damping suspension, an SRT Power Chiller, a line locker, 18″ aluminum wheels, and Brembo brake calipers. Additional equipment includes HID Air-Catcher headlamps, widebody fenders, heated and ventilated front seats, and a UConnect infotainment system. It was sold on BaT in July 2023 and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2026. This Challenger SRT Super Stock has 1,900 miles and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a Texas title.
The car is finished in Pitch Black (PX8) with satin black front and rear spoilers. Additional details include an aluminum hood with dual air scoops as well as HID Air-Catcher headlamps, widebody fenders, window tint film, Redeye badging, and rear parking sensors.

advert.headline: One-Owner 2018 Ford Mustang Shelby GT350
advert.description:
This 2018 Ford Mustang Shelby GT350 was purchased new by the current owner and now has 7k miles. The car is finished in Kona Blue Metallic over Ebony leather and Miko suede and was optioned with white over-the-top racing stripes, a black-painted roof, and the Convenience Package, which added SYNC 3 infotainment, navigation, dual-zone automatic climate control, and heated and cooled front seats. Power comes from a 5.2-liter Voodoo V8 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential, and the car is further equipped with 19″ wheels, Brembo brake calipers, a rear spoiler, and a rearview camera. This GT350 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a damage-free Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Kona Blue Metallic (L6) and was optioned with over-the-top white racing stripes and a black-painted roof. Features include HID projector headlights, functional hood and fender vents, a front splitter with the Shelby logo, a raised decklid spoiler, LED taillights with sequential turn signals, and quad exhaust outlets.

advert.headline: 1964 Alfa Romeo 2600 Spider
advert.description:
This 1964 Alfa Romeo 2600 is one of 2,255 Touring-bodied Spider convertibles built during four years of production, and it was produced on July 22, 1964 for delivery to Newark, New Jersey. In 2015, the car was exported to the UK and was refurbished over the next several years before being brought back to the US in 2020. It has been refinished in red over cream leather upholstery, and power is provided by a 2,584cc DOHC inline-six fed by triple Solex carburetors and linked to a five-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a black convertible top, dual side mirrors, disc brakes, Fergat steel wheels with hubcaps, an independent front suspension, low-back bucket seats, and Pioneer speakers. This Tipo 106 2600 Spider is now offered by the selling dealer, a BaT Local Partner , at no reserve with spare parts, an Alfa Romeo Classiche certificate, a tool kit, service records, and transferable New York registration.
The 2600 platform was introduced as Alfa Romeo’s flagship range in 1962 and was offered as a sedan, coupe, or convertible, the latter of which wore coachwork from Touring of Milan. This example was finished from the factory in Grigio Biacca and was repainted red during the aforementioned refurbishment. The brightwork was re-chromed at that time, while a replacement mohair black soft top was installed after the car was brought back to the US. Paint meter readings are viewable in the gallery along with images of blemishes around the body.
